stamineus: <entryFree id="n45245" type="main" key="sta_mi^ne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stāmĭnĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45245.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of threads</hi>, <hi rend="ital">full of threads</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thready</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rota rhombi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:6" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 6</bibl></cit> (4, 5), 26: <cit><quote lang="la">vena ligni,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>fibrous</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:226" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 43, 83, § 226</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stannatio: <entryFree id="n45246" type="main" key="stanna_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stannātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45246.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a trowel</hi> (late Lat.): stannatio sive trulla caementarii, Hier. in Amos, 3, 7.</sense></entryFree>
stannatura: <entryFree id="n45247" type="main" key="stanna_tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stannātūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45247.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">plastering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">varnishing</hi> (late Lat.), Hier. in Amos, 3, 7.</sense></entryFree>
stanneus: <entryFree id="n45248" type="main" key="stanne^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stannĕus</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">stagnĕus</orth>), <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stannum</etym>, <sense id="n45248.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">made of</hi> stannum: vasa, Plaut. Fragm. ap. Fest. s. v. narica, p. 166 Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 7, 19, § 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cacabus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:12:42:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 12, 42, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pyxis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 2, 10, § 35</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:38" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 5, 12, § 38</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nummi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:48:10:9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 48, 10, 9</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stannum: <entryFree id="n45249" type="main" key="stannum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stannum</orth> (perh. also <orth extent="full" lang="la">stagnum</orth>; hence 2. stagno and stagneus, v. stanneus), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <sense id="n45249.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an alloy of silver and lead</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 16, 47, § 159</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:130" default="NO" valid="yes">33, 9, 45, § 130</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vit.:5" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vit. 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—</sense><sense id="n45249.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Tin</hi> (late Lat. for plumbum album or candidum), <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Zach. 1, 4, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Isid.</author> Orig. 16, 22</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
staphis: <entryFree id="n45250" type="greek" key="sta^phis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stăphis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stafi/s</foreign>, <sense id="n45250.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, perh. <hi rend="ital">licebane</hi>, <hi rend="ital">staves - acre</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 1, 13, § 17</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 27, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
staphyla: <entryFree id="n45251" type="main" key="Sta^phy^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stăphyla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stăphylē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stafulh/</foreign>, <sense id="n45251.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a woman</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:2:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 2, 3, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
staphylinus: <entryFree id="n45252" type="greek" key="staphy^li_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">staphylīnus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">-os</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stafuli=nos</foreign>, <sense id="n45252.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of parsnip</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 5, 27, § 88</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:112" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 9, 64, § 112</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:168" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 168</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
staphylodendron: <entryFree id="n45253" type="greek" key="sta^phy^lo^dendron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stăphylŏdendron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stafulo/dendron</foreign>, <sense id="n45253.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the pistachio - tree</hi>: Staphylea pinnata, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 16, 27, § 69</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
staphyloma: <entryFree id="n45254" type="greek" key="staphy^lo_ma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">staphylōma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stafu/lwma</foreign>, <sense id="n45254.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a blemish in the eye</hi> shaped like a grape. stone, <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 3, 19, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
staphylus: <entryFree id="n45255" type="main" key="Staphy^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Staphylus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45255.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a son of Silenus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who taught the art of mixing wine with water</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> H. 1, 87</bibl> Dietsch; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 199</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
staseas: <entryFree id="n45256" type="main" key="Stase^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stasĕas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45256.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Peripatetic philosopher of Neapolis</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:22:104" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 1, 22, 104</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:3:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 3, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 25, 75</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stasiastae: <entryFree id="n45257" type="main" key="Sta^si^astae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stăsĭastae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*stasiastai/</foreign>, <sense id="n45257.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a tragedy of Attius</hi>, v. the Fragments, <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 20, 25 al.</bibl>; Trag. Rel. p. 214 sqq. Rib.</sense></entryFree>
stasimum: <entryFree id="n45258" type="greek" key="sta^si^mum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stăsĭmum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sta/simon</foreign>, <sense id="n45258.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that part of a poem which was sung standing</hi>, Mar. Vict. 2, p. 2522 P.</sense></entryFree>
stasimus: <entryFree id="n45259" type="main" key="Sta^si^mus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stăsĭmus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45259.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,019:2:4:3 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Trin. 2, 4, 3 al.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
statae: <entryFree id="n45260" type="gloss" key="sta^tae"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătae mātris</orth> <itype>simulacrum in foro colebatur</itype>, identical with that of <sense id="n45260.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">Vesta</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=317" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 317</bibl> Müll.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:11:28" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 11, 28</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 1386 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
statanum: <entryFree id="n45261" type="main" key="sta^ta_num"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătānum vīnum</orth>, <sense id="n45261.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an excellent kind of wine</hi> in Campania, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 65</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:36" default="NO" valid="yes">23, 1, 21, § 36</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
statanus: <entryFree id="n45262" type="main" key="Sta^ta_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stătānus</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stătŭlīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sto</etym>, <sense id="n45262.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the deity who presided over the standing of children</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 532, 24 sq.</bibl>; Aug. Civ. Dei, 4, 21.—As <hi rend="ital">a female deity</hi>, called <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stătīna</orth>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Anim. 39</bibl>. <pb n="1751" /> <cb n="STAT" /></sense></entryFree>
statarius: <entryFree id="n45263" type="main" key="sta^ta_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sto</etym>, <sense id="n45263.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to standing</hi> or <hi rend="ital">standing fast</hi>, <hi rend="ital">standing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">standing firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stationary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steady</hi> (very rare; usually stabilis). </sense><sense id="n45263.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">statarius miles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:22:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 22, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">retia,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>that remain long in the water</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 2, 2 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prandium,</quote> <trans><tr>eaten standing</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Grat. Act. ad Jul. 11 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">congressio,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a battle in the open field</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 2, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45263.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tranquil;</hi> of an orator: <cit><quote lang="la">C. Piso, statarius et sermonis plenus orator,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:68:239" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 68, 239</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45263.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stătārĭa</orth> (sc. comoedia), <hi rend="ital">a kind of comedy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">so called from the quiet acting of the performers</hi> (opp. motoria, bustling, noisy), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 36 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 36 sq.</bibl> Don. ad loc. and ad; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:prol. 24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. prol. 24</bibl>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stătārĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the actors in the</hi> comoedia stataria, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:30:116" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 30, 116</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
statelli: <entryFree id="n45264" type="main" key="Statelli"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Statelli</orth>, v. Statielli.</entryFree>
stater: <entryFree id="n45265" type="greek" key="sta^ter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stăter</orth>, <itype>ēris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stath/r</foreign>, <sense id="n45265.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a small silver coin of the Jews</hi>, of the value of four drachmae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Matt. 3, 17, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,011:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Reg. 9, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,001:17:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Matt. 17, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
statera: <entryFree id="n45266" type="main" key="sta^te_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătēra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>perhaps kindred with <foreign lang="greek">sta/qmh</foreign>, a rule</etym>, <sense id="n45266.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a steelyard;</hi> also, <hi rend="ital">a balance</hi> (syn.: libra, trutina). </sense><sense id="n45266.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 10, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 35</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=vesp.:25" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Vesp. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 3, 23, § 38</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:9:46" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 9, 46</bibl>: auraria, <hi rend="ital">a goldsmith's scales</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 455, 20</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">called also aurificis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:38:159" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 38, 159</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45266.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of any thing of a similar shape. * </sense><sense id="n45266.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">The pole-bar</hi> of a chariot, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:3:35" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 3, 35</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n45266.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A kind of platter</hi>, so called from its resemblance to the scale of a steelyard or balance, Nep. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:146" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 11, 52, § 146</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n45266.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">the value</hi> of a thing, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 26, 57, § 127</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
statianus: <entryFree id="n45267" type="main" key="Sta^ti^a_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stătĭānus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45267.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a lieutenant of Antony</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:82:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 82, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
statice: <entryFree id="n45268" type="greek" key="sta^ti^ce_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătĭcē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">statikh/</foreign>, <sense id="n45268.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an herb of an astringent quality</hi>: Statice armeria, Linn.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:26:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 26, 8, 33, § 51</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
staticulum: <entryFree id="n45269" type="main" key="sta^ti^cu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătĭcŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>statua</etym>. <sense id="n45269.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A little statue</hi> or <hi rend="ital">image</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a statuette</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 17, 48, § 163</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:37:140" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 10, 54, § 140</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45269.1" n="II" level="1"> Of <hi rend="ital">images of the gods</hi>, <hi rend="ital">idols</hi>, as a transl. of the Heb. <foreign />, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Gnost. 2</bibl> ex Deut. 12, 3; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi> ex Lev. 26, 1.</sense></entryFree>
staticulus: <entryFree id="n45270" type="main" key="sta^ti^cu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătĭcŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45270.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of gentle dance</hi>, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 2, 10 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 43</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
statielli: <entryFree id="n45271" type="main" key="Statielli"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Statielli</orth> (<orth type="alt" extent="full" lang="la">Statelli</orth>), <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45271.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a people of Liguria</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 7, § 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 21</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Their chief town</hi> was called Aquae Statiellorum, Plin. l. l.; or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Statĭellae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:2:2:section=4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 31, 2, 2, § 4</bibl>.—Hence, </sense><sense id="n45271.1" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sta-tiellas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to the Statielli</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sta-tiellātes</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:21" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 21</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n45271.2" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Statiellenses</orth>, <itype>ĭum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the inhabitants of</hi> Aquae Statiellorum, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 11, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
statilius: <entryFree id="n45272" type="main" key="Sta^ti^li^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stătĭlĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45272.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Roman name.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45272.1" n="I" level="1"> L. Statilius, <hi rend="ital">a fellow-conspirator with Catiline</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:3:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 3, 3, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 17:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 17, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:43:2" default="NO" valid="yes">43, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes">46, 3</bibl>; 55, 6.—</sense><sense id="n45272.2" n="II" level="1"> L. Statilius, <hi rend="ital">an augur</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 12, 13</bibl> and 14.—</sense><sense id="n45272.3" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">An indifferent actor</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,003:10:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Com. 10, 30</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45272.4" n="IV" level="1"> Statilius Taurus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 2:1:10" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 2, 1, 10</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2725 sq.</bibl></sense></entryFree>
statim: <entryFree id="n45273" type="main" key="sta^tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătim</orth> (a scanned long, <bibl default="NO"><author>Avien.</author> Arat. 397</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Alcim.</author> 2, 180</bibl>), <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>sto</etym>. <sense id="n45273.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Firmly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steadily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">steadfastly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unyieldingly</hi> (so only ante-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">nemo recedit loco, quin statim rem gerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 84</bibl></cit>; so, qui rem cum Achivis gesserunt statim, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 393, 14</bibl> (Trag. v. 39 Vahl.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">statim stant signa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 120</bibl></cit>: vectigalia legerunt vestra et servantur statim, <hi rend="ital">steadily</hi>, <hi rend="ital">regularly</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> p. 195</bibl> P. (statute et ordinate, Charis.); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex his praediis talenta argenti bina capiebat statim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:5:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 5, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: delaborat cum statim puer, <hi rend="ital">constantly</hi>, Afran. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 393, 16</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n45273.1" n="II" level="1"> Like our <hi rend="ital">on the spot</hi>, i. q. <hi rend="ital">forthwith</hi>, <hi rend="ital">straightway</hi>, <hi rend="ital">at once</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immediately</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instantly</hi> (the predom. signif. of the word; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: continuo, confestim, extemplo),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:4:1:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 4, 1, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Publicola lege illā perlatā statim secures de fascibus demi jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:31:55" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 31, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de se ter sortibus consultum dicebat, utrum igni statim necaretur, an in aliud tempus reservaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 53 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statim dimittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:59:200" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 59, 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui discedere animum censent, alii statim dissipari, alii diu permanere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:1:9" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 1, 9</bibl></cit>, <cb n="STAT" /> 18: <cit><quote lang="la">ut statim alienatio disjunctioque facienda sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:21:76" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 21, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">postremos in agmine temptare ac statim in collis regredi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 55:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 55, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">principio anni statim res turbulentae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 22, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:53:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 53, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">statim ac sine morā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:2" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:1" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45273.2" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>, <hi rend="ital">simul ac</hi>, <hi rend="ital">atque</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quam</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">cum</hi>, <hi rend="ital">immediately after</hi>, <hi rend="ital">as soon as</hi>, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">litteras scripsi horā decimā, statim, ut tuas legeram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:2:12:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 2, 12, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statim, ut dici (res) coepta est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:77:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 77, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut heri me salutavit, statim Romam profectus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:12:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 12, 18, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 2, 13, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">dicebat, statim se iturum, simul ac ludorum apparatum iis tradidisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:15:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 15, 12, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proconsul ubique proconsularia insignia habet statim atque Urbem egressus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 1, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proconsules, statim quam Urbem egressi fuerint, habent jurisdictionem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:2" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 1, 16, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semen statim cum spargitur, obruendum est,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Apr. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45273.3" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">abl. absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc sum aggressus statim Catone absoluto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:10:35" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 10, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostium navibus captis statim ex classe copias suas eduxit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,005:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Cim. 2, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45273.4" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ab</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">statim a primā luce,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:1:17" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a primā statim maturitate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 7, 18, § 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rami paene statim ab radice modici,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 16, 10, 18, § 41</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">post</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitationes campestres statim post civilia bella omisit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:83" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statim post putationem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Febr. 15 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—* </sense><sense id="n45273.5" n="B" level="2"> Rarely for recenter, modo, <hi rend="ital">recently</hi>, <hi rend="ital">newly</hi>, <hi rend="ital">just</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ventriculus vervecis statim occisi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 35, 13</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
statina: <entryFree id="n45274" type="main" key="Sta^ti_na"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stătīna</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, v. Statanus.</entryFree>
statio: <entryFree id="n45275" type="main" key="sta^ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sto</etym>, <sense id="n45275.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a standing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a standing still.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45275.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (so very rare; <cit><quote lang="la">not in Cic.): navis, quae manet in statione,</quote> <trans><tr>remains standing</tr>, <tr>stands still</tr>, <tr>does not move</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 388</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">manere in statione,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:396" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 4, 396</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:478" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 478</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:518" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 518</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in statione locata nubila,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:193" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 193</bibl></cit>: varas In statione manus et pugnae membra paravi, <hi rend="ital">in a firm posture</hi> (for fighting), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam id (sidus) stationem facere,</quote> <trans><tr>stands still</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 17, 15, § 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stationes matutinas facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 15, 12, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solus immobilem stationis gradum retinens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:23" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 2, 70</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45275.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">that which is established</hi> by custom or prescription, a transl. of the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">qematismo/s</foreign>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:1:2:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 1, 2, 5</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n45275.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in concr., a place where persons or things stay or abide, <hi rend="ital">a station</hi>, <hi rend="ital">post</hi>, <hi rend="ital">an abode</hi>, <hi rend="ital">residence.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45275.4" n="A" level="2"> In gen. (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">Athenis statio mea nunc placet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 6, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quā positus fueris in statione, mane,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:674" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 2, 674</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:5:719" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 719</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">principio sedes apibus statioque petenda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apricis statio gratissima mergis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 5, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equorum,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a stall</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 21, 2</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">jumentorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:7:1:13" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 7, 1, 13 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plerique in stationibus sedent tempusque audiendis fabulis conterunt,</quote> <trans><tr>in public places</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:13:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 13, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stationes circumeo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 2:9:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 9, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tabernas tris de domo suo circa forum civitatibus ad stationem locasset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:37" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">thermae, stationes, omne theatrum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:11:4" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 11, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:13:13:1" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 13, 13, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stationes municipiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 44, 86, § 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si ad stationem vel tabernam ventum sit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:10:15:section=7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 10, 15, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stationes hibernae,</quote> <trans><tr>winter-quarters</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 14, 1, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45275.5" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, of things, <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">position</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">pone recompositas in statione comas,</quote> <trans><tr>in their place</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:7:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 7, 68</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:3:434" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. A. 3, 434</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">permutata rerum statione, Petr. poët. 120, 99: umoris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> 1, 43</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45275.6" n="B" level="2"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n45275.7" n="1" level="3"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a post</hi>, <hi rend="ital">station</hi> (v. custodiae, vigilia): <cit><quote lang="la">cohortes ex statione et praesidio emissae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:6:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 6, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ii, qui pro portis castrorum in statione erant ... Cohortes quae in stationibus erant, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 32</bibl></cit>; 5, 15; 6, 37; <cit><quote lang="la">6, 38: in stationem succedere,</quote> <trans><tr>to relieve</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stationem inire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:35" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">relinquere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:222" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 222</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">deserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 35, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quique primi transierant, in statione erant, dum traicerent ceteri,</quote> <trans><tr>on guard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:18" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 5, 18</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: suis vicibus capiebant bina (lumina Argi) quietem; <cit><quote lang="la">Cetera servabant atque in statione manebant,</quote> <trans><tr>kept at their posts</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 627</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">2, 115</bibl>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">de praesidio et statione vitae decedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:20:73" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 20, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">functo longissimā statione mortali,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:131:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 131, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imperii statione relictā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:2:219" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 2, 219</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:124:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 124, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 17</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:38" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 38</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45275.8" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, like our <cb n="STAT" /> <hi rend="ital">post</hi>, <hi rend="ital">watch</hi>, <hi rend="ital">guard</hi>, for those who are stationed to watch, who stand guard, <hi rend="ital">sentries</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sentinels</hi>, <hi rend="ital">outposts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pickets</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut stationes dispositas haberent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:5:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 5, 16</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 69</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut minus intentae diurnae stationes ac nocturnae vigiliae essent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:24:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 24, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:38:16" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 38, 16</bibl>; cf. in <number>sing.</number>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad stationem Romanam in portā segniter agentem vigilias perveniunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:32:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 32, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dispositā statione per ripas Tiberis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:72" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">crebrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodiae stationesque equitum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statione militum assumptā,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>body-guard</tr>, <tr>lifeguard</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:24" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 24</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:21" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ner. 21</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">47</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45275.9" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">a station</hi>, <hi rend="ital">office</hi>, <hi rend="ital">position</hi>, in government, etc. (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">in hac statione, i. e. the imperial office,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Spart.</author> Ael. Verr. 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statio imperatoria,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Comm. 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Augusta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Clod. Alb. 2</bibl></cit>: regia, Vulc. 7; <bibl default="NO"><author>Capitol.</author> Verr. 8</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45275.10" n="3" level="3"> Naut. t. t., <hi rend="ital">an anchorage</hi>, <hi rend="ital">roadstead</hi>, <hi rend="ital">road</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inlet</hi> (syn. portus), Lentul. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:12:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 12, 15, 2</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quietam nactus stationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 8</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 56</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 10, 2, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:6:9" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 6, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:33:3" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 33, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:421" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 421</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:23 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 23 al.</bibl>—</sense><sense id="n45275.11" n="4" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A place of residence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a post</hi>, <hi rend="ital">station</hi> of the fiscal officers of a province; also, for the <hi rend="ital">officers</hi> themselves, Cod. Th. 12, 6, 19; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cod. Just.</author> 4, 31, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 5, 1</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 3207</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4107</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45275.12" n="5" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A post-station</hi>, <hi rend="ital">post-house</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 1015</bibl>; Morcell. Stil. Inscr. Lat. 1, p. 421.—</sense><sense id="n45275.13" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A religious meeting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assembly</hi> of the Christians: <cit><quote lang="la">die stationis, nocte vigiliae meminerimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Or. 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stationes in vesperam producere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> adv. Psych. 1</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ad Ux. 2, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stationalis: <entryFree id="n45276" type="hapax" key="sta^ti^o_na_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătĭōnālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>statio, I.</etym>, <sense id="n45276.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">standing still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stationary</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fixed</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 15, 12, § 60</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stationarius: <entryFree id="n45277" type="main" key="sta^ti^o_na_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătĭōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>statio, II.</etym>, <sense id="n45277.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to a post</hi> or <hi rend="ital">station</hi> (jurid. Lat.): stationarii milites, <hi rend="ital">soldiers stationed at a post</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a kind of gendarmery instituted by Augustus for suppressing the</hi> grassatores, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:32" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 32</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:4:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 11, 4, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:11:4:4" default="NO">11, 4, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:12:1" default="NO">1, 12, 1</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stătĭōnārĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> </sense><sense id="n45277.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A postman</hi>, <hi rend="ital">postmaster</hi> at a post - station, Cod. Th. 8, 5, 1.—</sense><sense id="n45277.2" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A police-officer</hi>, Cod. 12, 23, 1; 12, 58, 1; Cod. Th. 6, 29, 1; 8, 4, 2.</sense></entryFree>
statius: <entryFree id="n45278" type="main" key="Sta_ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stātĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <sense id="n45278.0" n="I" level="1"> Orig., <hi rend="ital">a name for slaves</hi>, acc. to <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:4:20:12" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 4, 20, 12</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">A slave of Cicero</hi> was thus named, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:16:16:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 16, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:1:2:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Q. Fr. 1, 2, 1, § 1</bibl>.—Also <hi rend="ital">a prœnomen of freemen</hi>, e. g. Statius Albius Oppianicus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 4, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45278.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A surname</hi> (cognomen or agnomen). </sense><sense id="n45278.2" n="A" level="2"> Caecilius Statius, <hi rend="ital">of Insubria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a comic poet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a younger contemporary of Ennius</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who died</hi> A. U. C. 586, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,041:1:2" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Opt. Gen. 1, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:3:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 3, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:17:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 17, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45278.3" n="B" level="2"> P. Papinius Statius, <hi rend="ital">a poet under Domitian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">author of the</hi> Silvae, <hi rend="ital">of the</hi> Thebais, <hi rend="ital">and of an unfinished poem entitled</hi> Achilleis, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:82" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 82</bibl> sqq.—</sense><sense id="n45278.4" n="C" level="2"> L. Statius Murcus, <hi rend="ital">a lieutenant and proconsul</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 12, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:69:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 69, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:77:4" default="NO">2, 77, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stativus: <entryFree id="n45279" type="main" key="sta^ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sto</etym>, <sense id="n45279.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">standing still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stationary.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45279.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (very rare): de stativis aquis, ut sunt lacus et stagna et putea et maria, <hi rend="ital">standing waters</hi>, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 217, 2</bibl>: tarditas, Firm. Math. 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—Of a light (transl. of Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sthrigmo/s</foreign>), App. de Mundo, 16, p. 64, 24.—</sense><sense id="n45279.2" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n45279.3" n="A" level="2"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to posts</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stations</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">quarters</hi> (the predom. signif. of the word): praesidium stativum, <hi rend="ital">appointed post</hi> or <hi rend="ital">station</hi> = statio, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 10, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 41, 1, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:40:6" default="NO" valid="yes">44, 40, 6</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra,</quote> <trans><tr>a stationary camp</tr>, <tr>a camp where an army halts for a long while</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">3, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:12:section=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 12, § 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 44:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 44, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 21 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> al.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45279.4" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">stătīva</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a stationary camp.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45279.5" n="(a)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:57:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 57, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:34:3" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 34, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:33:6" default="NO" valid="yes">31, 33, 6</bibl>; 37, 37, 1 and 5; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:66 al" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 66 al.</bibl>—* </sense><sense id="n45279.6" n="(b)" level="5"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of travellers: stativa, <hi rend="ital">a restingplace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stopping-place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quarters</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stativis dies absumuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 23, 26, § 103</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 1:8" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 1, 8</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n45279.7" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">stătīvae</orth>, <itype>ārum</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>: <cit><quote lang="la">mansiones, deinde stativae, deinde ubi annona esset accipienda,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lampr.</author> Alex. Sev. 45</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45279.8" n="B" level="2"> In relig. lang.: stativae feriae, <hi rend="ital">fixed</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stated feasts</hi> (usually statae feriae), <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 1, 16, § 5</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
statones: <entryFree id="n45280" type="main" key="Statones"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Statones</orth>, <itype>um</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45280.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the people of Statonia in Southern Etruria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">celebrated for its vines and stone-quarries</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 5, 8, § 52</bibl>. —Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">Statonĭensis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Statonia</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ager,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:95:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 95, 96</bibl></cit>, <pb n="1752" /> <cb n="STAT" /> § <cit><quote lang="la">209: vina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lacus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 3:25:8" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 3, 25, 8</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Statonĭensis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> (sc. ager), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:168" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 22, 49, § 168</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:12" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 12</bibl>. 1.</sense></entryFree>
stator: <entryFree id="n45281" type="main" key="sta^tor1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stător</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sto</etym>, <sense id="n45281.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a magistrate's attendant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">servant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">messenger</hi>, <hi rend="ital">orderly-man</hi> (since Augustus there were centuriae statorum Augusti): <cit><quote lang="la">statores mittere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:2:19:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 2, 19, 2</bibl></cit>; Planc. <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 10, 21, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:6:10" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 6, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:16:4" default="NO">1, 16, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2780</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3422</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">3524</bibl>; cf. Kellerm. Vigil. <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> 40</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">199</bibl> sq.; Jahn, Spec. Epigr. p. 28, n. 1; p. 49.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45282" type="main" key="Sta^tor2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stător</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sisto</etym>, one who causes any thing to stand fast, <sense id="n45282.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a stayer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">supporter</hi>, an epithet of Jupiter, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 12, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,013:1:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Cat. 1, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 13, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:20:66" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 20, 66</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:7:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 7, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:793" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 793</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:131" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 131</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:140" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 53, 54, § 140</bibl>.—Also, of Mars, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:131:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 131, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
statorius: <entryFree id="n45283" type="main" key="Statori^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Statorĭus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45283.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a Roman</hi> gens: <cit><quote lang="la">Q. Statorius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 48</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
statua: <entryFree id="n45284" type="main" key="sta^tu^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătŭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>statuo</etym>, <sense id="n45284.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an image</hi>, <hi rend="ital">statue</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">signum, effigies, imago) (commonly made of metal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:10" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 10</bibl></cit>); rarely of the gods: statuae deorum, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 782</bibl> P.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 18, § 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 2:42:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 2, 42, 1</bibl>.—But freq. and class. of men: <cit><quote lang="la">statuam dare auream Solidam faciundam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:3:80" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Curc. 3, 80</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuae et imagines, non animorum simulacra sed corporum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statua istius persimilis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:38:93" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 38, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statua equestris inaurata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:15:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 15, 41</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 7, 16</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:38:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 38, 83</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:20:section=48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 20, § 48</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ea statua, quae ad Opis per te posita in excelso est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:6:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 6, 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quaeret Pater urbium Subscribi statuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:24:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 24, 28</bibl></cit>.—As a designation of immovability, taciturnity, etc.: <cit><quote lang="la">ex hac statuā volo Erogitare, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:5:1:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 5, 1, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:4:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 4, 1, 7</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">statuā taciturnius exit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iste statuā pallidior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:80:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 80, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuarum ritu patiemur pannos et vincula?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 102, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45284.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A pillar</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">marmorea,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vop.</author> Aur. 37, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">salis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sedul.</author> Pasch. 1, 106</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
statualis: <entryFree id="n45285" type="gloss" key="sta^tu^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătŭālis</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>statua</etym>, = STATVARIVS, <sense id="n45285.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sculptor</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Murat.</author> 937, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
statuarius: <entryFree id="n45286" type="main" key="sta^tu^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45286.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to statues</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ars,</quote> <trans><tr>the art of making statues</tr>, <tr>statuary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 7, 16, § 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:37" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 5, 4, § 37</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">temperatura (aeris),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 34, 9, 20, § 97</bibl></cit>.—As <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45286.1" n="1" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">stătŭ-ārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">the art of statuary</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:156" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 12, 45, § 156</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:15" default="NO" valid="yes">36, 5, 4, § 15</bibl> (= ars fingendi). —</sense><sense id="n45286.2" n="2" level="3"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">stătŭārĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a maker of statues</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a statuary</hi> (syn. sculptor), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:21:1" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 21, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 88:15" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 88, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 8, 34, § 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
statuliber: <entryFree id="n45287" type="main" key="sta^tu_li_ber"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătūlīber</orth> (also separate, <orth extent="full" lang="la">stătū lī-ber</orth>), <itype>bĕri</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>prob. instead of statuto liber; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">infra</ref></xr></etym>, <sense id="n45287.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a slave to whom liberty is granted under a certain condition</hi> or <hi rend="ital">from a certain time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">generally by testament</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuliber est qui statutam et destinatam in tempus vel condicionem libertatem habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:7:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui sub condicione testamento liber esse jussus est, statu liber appellatur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 2, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>Titin.</author> 2</bibl> passim: <cit><quote lang="la">statuliber est qui testamento certā condicione propositā jubetur esse liber, Fest. s. v. statuliber, p. 249 L.: statuliberi, id est ejus servi quo testamento sub aliquā condicione liber esse jussus est, quem constat interea heredis servum esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:200" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 200</bibl></cit>: cum statuliber sub condicione legatus est, et pendente condicione legati condicio statutae libertatis deficit, legatum utile fit; <cit><quote lang="la">nam, sicut statuta libertas tunc perimit legatum cum vires accipit, ita, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:81:section=9" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 30, 1, 81, § 9</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:33:5:9" default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 33, 5, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:30:1:44:section=8" default="NO">30, 1, 44, § 8</bibl>; and the whole title of the <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:40:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 40, 7</bibl>, De statuliberis.—The word perhaps occurred in the XII. Tables: <cit><quote lang="la">sub hac condicione liber esse jussus ... ad libertatem perveniet: idque lex duodecim tabularum jubet,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Ulp.</author> Fragm. 2, 4</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
statulinus: <entryFree id="n45288" type="main" key="Statuli_nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Statulīnus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, v. Statanus.</entryFree>
statumaria: <entryFree id="n45289" type="main" key="sta^tu_ma_ri^a"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătūmārĭa</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45289.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">also called</hi> proserpinaca, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
statumen: <entryFree id="n45290" type="main" key="sta^tu_men"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătūmen</orth>, <itype>īnis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>statuo</etym>, <sense id="n45290.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that upon which any thing rests</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a support</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prop</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:2:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:16:2" default="NO">4, 16, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:18" default="NO">5, 5, 18</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:13:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 13, 12, 24, § 79</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45290.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a rib</hi> of a ship, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 54</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
statuminatio: <entryFree id="n45291" type="hapax" key="sta^tu_mi^na_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătūmĭnātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>statumino</etym>, <sense id="n45291.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an underpropping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">foundation</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
statumino: <entryFree id="n45292" type="main" key="sta^tu_mi^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătūmĭno</orth>, <itype>āre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>statumen</etym>, <sense id="n45292.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to prop up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to underprop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi> (post-Aug.): <cb n="STAT" /> oras fossarum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 6, 8, § 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid saxo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 7, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
statunculum: <entryFree id="n45293" type="hapax" key="sta^tuncu^lum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătuncŭlum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl> <etym>statua</etym>, <sense id="n45293.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a little statue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">statuette</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 50, 6</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
statuo: <entryFree id="n45294" type="main" key="sta^tu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, ūtum, 3</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>stătum, sup. of sto</etym>, <sense id="n45294.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to cause to stand</hi> (cf.: colloco, pono). </sense><sense id="n45294.1" n="I" level="1"> Corporeally. </sense><sense id="n45294.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cause to stand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi>, <hi rend="ital">station</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fix in an upright position.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45294.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To set up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set in the ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">erect</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi arbores pedicino in lapide statuito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">inter parietes arbores ubi statues,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipites statuito,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palis statutis crebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:14" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 14 <hi rend="ital">init.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedamenta jacentia statuenda,</quote> <trans><tr>are to be raised</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:26" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pedamentum inter duas vitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:194" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 21, § 194</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic statui volo primum aquilam,</quote> <trans><tr>the standard of the troops</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">signifer, statue signum,</quote> <trans><tr>plant the ensign</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:55:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 55, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:5:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 5, 1</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To plant</hi> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">eodem modo vineam statuito, alligato, flexatoque uti fuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:198" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 22, 35, § 198</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agro qui statuit meo Te, triste lignum (i. e. arborem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:2:13:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 2, 13, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.5" n="3" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set</hi> or <hi rend="ital">fix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set forth</hi> things or persons. </sense><sense id="n45294.6" n="a" level="4"> Without specifying the place: <cit><quote lang="la">ollam statuito cum aquā,</quote> <trans><tr>let a jar stand with water</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 156</bibl></cit> (157): <cit><quote lang="la">crateras magnos statuunt, i. e. on the table,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:724" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 724</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">crateras laeti statuunt,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 147</bibl></cit>: haec carina satis probe fundata et bene statuta est, <hi rend="ital">well placed</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">so that the hull stands</hi> perpendicularly (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">bene lineatam carinam collocavit, v. 42),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quidquam explicare, nec statuere potuerant, nec quod statutum esset, manebat, omnia perscindente vento,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:58:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 58, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo die tabernacula statui passus non est,</quote> <trans><tr>to pitch</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 81</bibl></cit>; so, aciem statuere, <hi rend="ital">to draw up an army</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aciem quam arte statuerat, latius porrigit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 52:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 52, 6</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.7" n="b" level="4"> With designation of the place by <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>abl.</case>; by <hi rend="ital">adv. of place;</hi> by <hi rend="ital">ante</hi>, <hi rend="ital">apud</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">circa</hi>, <hi rend="ital">super</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and acc.;</hi> by <hi rend="ital">pro</hi> and <case>abl.</case>; by <case>abl.</case> alone (very rare), or by <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <case>acc.</case> (very rare): signa domi pro supellectile statuere, Cato ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> 7, 19, 95</bibl> (p. 782 P.): <cit><quote lang="la">statuite hic lectulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:1:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 5, 1, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">etiamsi in caelo Capitolium statueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:3:46:180" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 3, 46, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuitur Sollius in illo gladiatorum convivio ... atuitur, ut dico, eques Romanus in Apronii convivio,</quote> <trans><tr>is taken to the banquet</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:25:section=61 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 25, § 61 sq.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tabernacula in foro statuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:46:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 46, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in principiis statuit tabernaculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:7:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 7, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in nostris castris tibi tabernaculum statue,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:11:6" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 11, 6</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:13:20" default="NO">8, 13, 20</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">statui in medium undique conspicuum tabernaculum jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:9:6:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 6, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(sagittae) longae, nisi prius in terrā statuerent arcum, haud satis apte imponuntur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 14, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedes curules sacerdotum Augustalium locis, superque eas querceae coronae statuerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 83</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">donum deae apud Antium statuitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pro rigidis calamos columnis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:529" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 529</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jamque ratem Scythicis auster statuisset in oris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:3:653" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 3, 653</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuere vas in loco frigido,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Oct. 22</bibl></cit>.—Of living beings: <cit><quote lang="la">capite in terram statuerem, Ut cerebro dispergat viam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:3:2:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Ad. 3, 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui capite ipse sua in statuit vestigia sese (= qui sese ipse capite in sua vestigia statuit),</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>stands on his head</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:472" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 472</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">patrem ejus a mortuis excitasses, statuisses ante oculos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:1:57:245" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 1, 57, 245</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">captivos vinctos in medio statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:42:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 42, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi primum equus Curtium in vado statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:13:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 13, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quattuor cohortes in fronte statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:33:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 33, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante se statuit funditores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:58:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 58, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puerum ad canendum ante tibicinem cum statuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 2, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">procul in conspectu eum (Philopoemenem) statuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:49:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 49, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">media porta robora legionum, duabus circa portis milites levemque armaturam statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:16:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 23, 16, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bovem ad fanum Dianae et ante aram statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:45:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 45, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Calchanta circa aram statuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:8:11" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 8, 11</bibl></cit>, ext. 6: <cit><quote lang="la">marium si qui eo loci statuisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:1:2" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 1, 2 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentes ante Caesarem statuunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in fronte statuerat ferratos, in cornibus cohortes,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">puer quis Ad cyathum statuetur?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:29:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 29, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu cum pro vitulā statuis dulcem Aulide natam Ante aras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:199" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> S. 2, 3, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et statuam ante aras auratā fronte juvencum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:627" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 627</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">clarā regione profundi Aetheros innumeri statuerunt agmina cygni,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:525" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 525</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.8" n="4" level="3"> Pregn., <hi rend="ital">to construct and place</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to set up after constructing</hi>,<cb n="STAT" />  <hi rend="ital">to erect</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45294.9" n="a" level="4"> Of statues, temples, columns, altars, trophies, etc.; constr. with <case>acc.</case> alone, or <hi rend="ital">acc. of the structure</hi> and <hi rend="ital">dat. of the person</hi> for whom or in whose honor it is erected: <cit><quote lang="la">siquidem mihi aram et statuam statuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:3:3:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 3, 3, 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">huic statuam statui decet ex auro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne ego aureā pro statuā vineam tibi statuam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eique statuam equestrem in rostris statui placere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:15:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 5, 15, 41</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 9, 5, 10</bibl>; 9, 7, 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:62:section=151" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 62, § 151</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2, 20, § 48</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">simulacrum alicui statuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:1:1:8" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 1, 1, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">effigiem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:184" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 184</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Mancinus eo habitu sibi statuit quo, etc. (effigiem),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 5, 10, § 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">simulacrum in curiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quānam in civitate tempium statueretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 55</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se primos templum urbis Romae statuisse,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 56</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tibi de Pario statuam, Germanice, templum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:4:8:31" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 4, 8, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">templa tibi statuam, tribuam tibi turis honorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:128" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 14, 128</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">super terrae tumulum noluit quid statui nisi columellam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:26:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 26, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">victimas atque aras diis Manibus statuentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuitque aras e cespite,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 7, 240</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuantur arae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 579" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 579</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aëneum statuerunt tropaeum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:23:69" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 23, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">monumentum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit> § 70; so, <cit><quote lang="la">in alio orbe tropaea statuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:14" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7, 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 3, 3, 4, § 18</bibl></cit>: ut illum di perdant qui primus statuit hic solarium, Plaut. Fragm. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:5" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 5</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">princeps Romanis solarium horologium statuisse L. Papirius Cursor proditur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:213" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 60, 60, § 213</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">a miliario in capite
