Romani fori statuto,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 5, 9, § 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">carceres eo anno in Circo primum statuti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 20, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo molem hanc immanis equi statuere?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo altiorem statui crucem jussit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=gal.:9" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Galb. 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">obeliscam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:36:71" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 36, 9, 14, § 71</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">at nunc disturba quas statuisti machinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:137" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 137</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">incensis operibus quae statuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:7:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si vallum statuitur procul urbis illecebris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">castra in quinto lapide a Carthagine statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:6:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 22, 6, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.10" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Poet.</usg> and in post-class. prose (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem statuere = alicui statuam statuere: inter et Aegidas mediā statuaris in urbe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:2:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 2, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuarque tumulo hilaris et coronatus,</quote> <trans><tr>my statue will be erected</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,003:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> Dial. 13</bibl></cit>; so with two <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: custodem medio statuit quam vilicus horto, <hi rend="ital">whose statue he placed as protectress</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:3:68:9" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 3, 68, 9</bibl>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in double sense: nudam te statuet, i. e. nudam faciet (= nudabit fortunis), and statuam tibi nu dam faciet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:28:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 28, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.11" n="5" level="3"> Of cities, etc., <hi rend="ital">to establish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">found</hi>, <hi rend="ital">build</hi> (in class. prose usu. condo): <cit><quote lang="la">Agamemnon tres ibi urbes statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:1:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbem quam statuo vestra est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:573" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 573</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbom praeclaram,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 655</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Persarum statuit Babylona Semiramis urbem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:11" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 11</bibl></cit> (4, 10), 21: <cit><quote lang="la">ibi civitatem statuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:23:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 23, 1</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">licentia et impunitas asyla statuendi (= aperiendi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 60</bibl></cit>.—Hence, transf.: carmen statuere = carmen condere, <hi rend="ital">to compose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">devise a song</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc volucrum ... inexpertum carmen, quod tacitā statuere brumā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:4:5:12" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 4, 5, 12</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.12" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cause to stand still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to stop</hi> (rare; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">sisto, III. B.): navem extemplo statuimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:2:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 2, 3, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et statuit fessos, fessus et ipse, boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 9, 4: <cit><quote lang="la">famuli hoc modo statuerunt aquas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Arn.</author> 1, p. 30</bibl></cit>: sanguinem, Oct. <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> 4</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.13" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cause to stand firm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">strengthen</hi>, <hi rend="ital">support</hi> (rare; = stabilire), only transf.: qui rem publicam certo animo adjuverit, statuerit, Att. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:56:120" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sest. 56, 120</bibl> (Trag. Rel. v. 357 Rib.).</sense><sense id="n45294.14" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45294.15" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To establish</hi>, <hi rend="ital">constitute</hi> (= constituo). </sense><sense id="n45294.16" n="1" level="3"> Esp.: exemplum or documentum (v. edo <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>, and cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Phoen. 320" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Phoen. 320</bibl>), <hi rend="ital">to set forth an example</hi> or <hi rend="ital">precedent</hi> for warning or imitation: <cit><quote lang="la">statuite exemplum impudenti, date pudori praemium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:3:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 3, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exemplum statuite in me ut adulescentuli Vobis placere studeant potius quam sibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 35, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut illi intellegere possint, in quo homine statueris exemplum hujus modi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:45:section=111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 45, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quos aliquid exempli populus Romanus statui putat oportere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 90</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">210: statuam in te exemplum, ne quis posthac infelicibus miseriis patriae illudat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:7:14" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 8, 7, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">documentum autem statui oportere, si quis resipiscat et antiquam societatem respiciat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:45:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 45, 5</bibl></cit>: statueretur immo <pb n="1753" /> <cb n="STAT" /> documentum, quo uxorem imperator acciperet, <hi rend="ital">a precedent</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 6</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.17" n="2" level="3"> Jus statuere, <hi rend="ital">to establish a principle</hi> or <hi rend="ital">relation of law</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut (majores nostri) omnia omnium rerum jura statuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:12:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 12, 34</bibl></cit>: qui magistratum potestatemve habebit, si quid in aliquem novi juris statuerit, ipse quoque, adversario postulante, eodem jure uti debebit, <hi rend="ital">if he has established any new principle of law</hi>, Edict. Praet. in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:2:1:section=1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 2, 1, § 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid injungere inferiori velis, id prius in te ac tuos si ipse juris statueris, facilius omnes oboedientes habeas,</quote> <trans><tr>if you first admit it against yourself</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:36:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 36, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si dicemus in omnibus aequabile jus statui convenire,</quote> <trans><tr>equal principles of law should be applied to all</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 3, 3, 4</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n45294.18" n="3" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to establish</hi> by authority (of relations, institutions, rights, duties, etc.): <cit><quote lang="la">(Numa) omnis partis religionis statuit sanctissime,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:14:26" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 14, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc judicium sic exspectatur ut non unae rei statui, sed omnibus constitui putetur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,006:15:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tull. 15, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad formandos animos statuendasque vitae leges, Quint. prooem. 14: sic hujus (virtutis) ut caelestium statuta magnitudo est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 79:10" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 79, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigal etiam novum ex salariā annonā statuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:29:37:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 29, 37, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">novos statuere fines,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:24:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 24, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque eos quos statuit terminos observat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:44:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 44, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quibus rebus cum pax statuta esset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:5:10:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 5, 10, 8</bibl></cit>; so <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:25:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 25, 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sedesque ibi statuentibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:5:11" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 18, 5, 11</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.19" n="4" level="3"> With double <case>acc.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to constitute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appoint</hi>, <hi rend="ital">create</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hirtius arbitrum me statuebat non modo hujus rei, sed totius consulatus sui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 1</bibl></cit>, a, 2: <cit><quote lang="la">telluris erum natura nec illum, nec quemquam constituit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:2:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 2, 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de principatu (vinorum) se quisque judicem statuet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 6, 8, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">praefectus his statuitur Andragoras,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:4:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 4, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.20" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To determine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fix</hi>, etc. (of temporal or local relations); constr. usually with <case>acc.</case> and <case>dat.</case> or <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45294.21" n="1" level="3"> Modum statuere alicui or alicujus rei, <hi rend="ital">to determine the manner</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mode</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">measure</hi> of, <hi rend="ital">assign limits</hi>, <hi rend="ital">restrictions</hi> or <hi rend="ital">restraints</hi> to a thing or person, <hi rend="ital">to impose restraints upon.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45294.22" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">diuturnitati imperii modum statuendum putavistis,</quote> <trans><tr>that a limit should be assigned to the duration of his power</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statui mihi tum modum et orationi meae,</quote> <trans><tr>imposed restraints upon myself and my words</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:63:section=163" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 63, § 163</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non statuendo felicitati modum, nec cohibendo fortunam,</quote> <trans><tr>by not assigning any limits to his success</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:30:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 30, 23</bibl></cit> (Pompeium) affirmabant, libertati publicae statuturum modum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:2:40" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 2, 40</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupidinibus statuat natura modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:2:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 2, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quem modum sibi ipsa statuit (crudelitas)?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:9:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 9, 2</bibl></cit> pr.: <cit><quote lang="la">modum ipsae res statuunt (i. e. sibi),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:216" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 15, 61, § 216</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">modum nuptiarum sumptibus statuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:21:4:5" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 21, 4, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">timori quem meo statuam modum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 483" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 483</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and with finem: jam statui aerumnis modum et finem cladi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 206" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Herc. Fur. 206</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n45294.23" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">honestius te inimicitiarum modum statuere potuisse quam me humanitatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:17:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 17, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse modum statuam carminis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:11:44" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 11, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">errorisque sui sic statuisse modum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:12" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 12</bibl></cit> (4, 11), 36: <cit><quote lang="la">modum statuunt fellis pondere denarii,</quote> <trans><tr>they limit the quantity of the gall to the weight of a denarius</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 19, 77, § 254</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.24" n="2" level="3"> Condicionem or legem alicui, <hi rend="ital">to impose a condition</hi> or <hi rend="ital">law upon one</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to dictate</hi>, <hi rend="ital">assign a condition to</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hanc tu condicionem statuis Gaditanis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:10:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 10, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">providete ne duriorem vobis condicionem statuatis ordinique vestro quam ferre possit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,030:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Rab. Post. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alter eam sibi legem statuerat ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:10:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 10, 6, 12</bibl></cit>: pretio statutā lege ne modum excederet, etc., <hi rend="ital">the law being assigned to the price that not</hi>, etc., i. e. <hi rend="ital">the price being limited by the law</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:118" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 7, 40, § 118</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pacis legem universae Graeciae statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:9:5:2" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 9, 5, 2</bibl></cit>.—So with ellipsis of <case>dat.</case>, <hi rend="ital">to agree upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stipulate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">statutis condicionibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:6:1:3" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 6, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnibus consentientibus Carthago conditur, statuto annuo vectigali pro solo urbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:18:5:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 18, 5, 14</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n45294.25" n="3" level="3"> Finem, <hi rend="ital">to assign</hi> or <hi rend="ital">put an end to</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make an end of</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud opinor commode Finem statuisse orationi militem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,005:1:2:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Hec. 1, 2, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">et finem statuit cuppedinis atque timoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 25</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum Fulvius Flaccus finem poenae eorum statuere cogeretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit>, ext. 1: majores vestri omnium magnarum rerum et principia exorsi <cb n="STAT" /> ab diis sunt, et finem statuerunt, <hi rend="ital">finished</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:39:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 39, 10</bibl>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">terminum: nam templis numquam statuetur terminus aevi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:180" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 180</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum consilii tui bene fortiterque suscepti eum tibi finem statueris, quem ipsa fortuna terminum nostrarum contentionum esse voluisset,</quote> <trans><tr>since you have assigned that end</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:6:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 6, 22, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.26" n="4" level="3"> Pretium alicui rei, <hi rend="ital">to assign a price to something; fix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determine the price of something</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae probast mers, pretium ei statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 132</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam avare pretium statui arti meae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:prol. 48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. prol. 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuit frumento pretium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 87</bibl></cit>; so with <case>dat.</case> understood: <cit><quote lang="la">ut eos (obsides) pretio quantum ipsi statuissent patres redimi paterentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:42:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 42, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pretium statuit (i. e. vecturae et sali),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:29:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 45, 29, 13</bibl></cit>; so with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: ut in singulas amphoras (vini) centeni nummi statuantur, <hi rend="ital">that the price may be set down at</hi> 100 <hi rend="ital">sesterces for an amphora</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 4, 6, § 56</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.27" n="5" level="3"> Statuere diem, horam, tempus, locum alicui rei, or alicui, or with <hi rend="ital">dat. gerund.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to assign</hi> or <hi rend="ital">appoint a day</hi>, <hi rend="ital">time</hi>, <hi rend="ital">place</hi>, etc. (for the more usual diem dicere): <cit><quote lang="la">statutus est comitiis dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:27:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 27, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem patrando facinori statuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:35:35:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 35, 35, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multitudini diem statuit ante quam sine fraude liceret ab armis discedere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 36, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dies insidiis statuitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 70:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> J. 70, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad tempus locumque colloquio statuendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:35:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 35, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subverti leges quae sua spatia (= tempora) quaerendis aut potiundis honoribus statuerint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 36</bibl></cit>.—With ellipsis of <hi rend="ital">dat.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">observans quem statuere diem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:4:54:6" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 4, 54, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem unam poscit: statuitur nox,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 44</bibl></cit>.—Esp. in the <hi rend="ital">part.</hi> statutus, <hi rend="ital">fixed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">appointed</hi> (in MSS. and edd. often confounded with status; v. sisto <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>): <cit><quote lang="la">institum ut quotannis ... libri diebus statutis (statis) recitarentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:42" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut die statutā omnes equos ante regiam producerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:10:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 1, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quaedam (genera) statutum tempus anni habent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 18, 30, § 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fruges quoque maturitatem statuto tempore expectant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:3:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 6, 3, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sacrificium non esse redditum statuto tempore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:2:6" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 8, 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuto tempore quo urbem Mithridati traderet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:16:4:9" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 16, 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum ad statutam horam omnes convenissent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:1:10:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 10, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">intra tempus statutum,</quote> <trans><tr>fixed by the law</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:4:19" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 4, 19</bibl></cit> and 20.—</sense><sense id="n45294.28" n="6" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To recount</hi>, <hi rend="ital">count up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">state</hi> (very rare): statue sex et quinquaginta annos, quibus mox divus Augustus rempublicam rexit: adice Tiberii tres et viginti ... centum et viginti anni colliguntur, <hi rend="ital">count</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fix</hi> the number <hi rend="ital">at</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 17</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Cinyphiae segetis citius numerabis aristas ... quam tibi nostrorum statuatur summa laborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:7:29" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 7, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.29" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To decide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determine</hi>, with reference to a result, <hi rend="ital">to settle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fix</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bring about</hi>, <hi rend="ital">choose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make a decision.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45294.30" n="1" level="3"> Of disputes, differences, questions, etc., between others. </sense><sense id="n45294.31" n="(a)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">interrog.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut statuatis hoc judicio utrum posthac amicitias clarorum virorum calamitati hominibus an ornamento esse malitis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:28:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 28, 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eam potestatem habetis ut statuatis utrum nos ... semper miseri lugeamus, an, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in hoc homine statuatis, possitne senatoribus judicantibus homo nocentissim us pecuniosissimusque damnari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:16:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 1, 16, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos statuite, recuperatores, utra (sententia) utilior esse videatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:27:77" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 27, 77</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decidis tu statuisque quid iis ad denarium solveretur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 4, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">magni esse judicis statuere quid quemque cuique praestare oporteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:17:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 17, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mihi vero Pompeius statuisse videtur quid vos in judicando spectare oporteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:6:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 6, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semel (senatus) statuerent quid donatum Masinissae vellent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 23</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec quid faciendum modo sit statuunt, sed, etc.,</quote> <trans><tr>decide</tr>, <tr>dictate</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nondum statuerat conservaret eum necne,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:11:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 11, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statutumque (est) quantum curules, quantum plebei pignoris caperent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 28</bibl></cit>: semel nobis esse statuendum quod consilium in illo sequamur, August. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:4" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 4</bibl>. —</sense><sense id="n45294.32" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut consules de Caesaris actis cognoscerent, statuerent, judicarent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, B, 8: <cit><quote lang="la">et collegas suos de religione statuisse, in senatu de lege statuturos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut de absente eo C. Licinius statueret ac judicaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si de summā rerum liberum senatui permittat rex statuendi jus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 62</bibl></cit>: qui ab exercitu ab imperatore eove cui de eā re statuendi potestas fuerit, dimissus erit, Edict. Praet. in <cb n="STAT" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:3:2:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 3, 2, 1</bibl>.—Often with reference to punishment: <cit><quote lang="la">cum de P. Lentulo ceterisque statuetis, pro certo habetote, vos simul de exercitu Catilinae decernere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">satis visum de Vestiliā statuere,</quote> <trans><tr>to pass sentence against</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:85" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">jus statuendi de procuratoribus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">facta patribus potestate statuendi de Caeciliano,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 7</bibl></cit>; so <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 13, 28</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 15, 14</bibl>; 2, 85; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:61" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 61 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>—In partic.: de se statuere, <hi rend="ital">to decide on</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">dispose of one's self</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">of one's life</hi>, = <hi rend="ital">to commit suicide</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">eorum qui de se statuebant humabantur corpora,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.33" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> and <case>abl.</case> and <hi rend="ital">interrog.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quibusdam populis permittendum esse videatur ut statuant ipsi de suis rebus quo jure uti velint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:8:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 8, 22</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.34" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">contra</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">consequeris tamen ut eos ipsos quos contra statuas aequos placatosque dimittas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:10:34" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 10, 34</bibl></cit>. —（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">indef. obj.</hi>, usu. a <hi rend="ital">neutr. pron.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">utrum igitur hoc Graeci statuent ... an nostri praetores?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fl. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dixisti quippiam: fixum (i. e. id) et statutum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:30:62" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 30, 62</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eoque utrique quod statuit contenti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus, ne quid absente rege statueret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:24:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 24, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">maturato opus est, quidquid statuere placet (senatui),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:13:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 13, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">id ubi in P. Licinio ita statutum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:15:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 15, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">interrogatus quid ipse victorem statuere debere censeret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:14:43" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 14, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid in futurum statuerim, aperiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 37</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">utque rata essent quae procuratores sui in judicando statuerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:12" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 12</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">qul statuit aliquid parte inauditā alterā, aequum licet statuerit, haud aequus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Med. 2:199" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Med. 2, 199</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ergo quod libet statuere arbiter potest,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:4:8:32:section=15" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 4, 8, 32, § 15</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">earum rerum quas Caesar statuisset, decrevisset, egisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 16, 16</bibl></cit>, C, 11.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">de</hi> or <hi rend="ital">super</hi> and <case>abl.</case>: <cit><quote lang="la">vos de crudelissimis parricidis quid statuatis cunctamini?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nihil super eā re nisi ex voluntate filii statuere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne quid super tantā re absente principe statueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 9</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">h</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>, mostly <hi rend="ital">pass. impers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita expediri posse consilium ut pro merito cujusque statueretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tunc ut quaeque causa erit statuetis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:53:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 53, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ex rumore statuendum,</quote> <trans><tr>decisions should not be founded on rumors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 69</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">q</foreign>) With <hi rend="ital">cognoscere</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to examine</hi> (<hi rend="ital">officially</hi>) <hi rend="ital">and decide</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">petit ut vel ipse de eo causā cognitā statuat, vel civitatem statuere jubeat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consuli ut cognosceret statueretque senatus permiserat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:3:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">missuros qui de eorum controversiis cognoscerent statuerentque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:20:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 20, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:13:11" default="NO" valid="yes">45, 13, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod causā cognitā erit statuendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11:2:section=8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 11, 2, § 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.35" n="2" level="3"> With reference to the mind of the subject, <hi rend="ital">to decide</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to make up one's mind</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conclude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be convinced</hi>, usu. with <hi rend="ital">interrog.clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam intellegis, statuendum tibi esse, utrum illi homicidae sint an vindices libertatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 12, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">illud mirum videri solet, tot homines ... statuere non potuisse, utrum judicem an arbitrum, rem an litem dici oporteret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:12:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mur. 12, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neque tamen possum statuere, utrum magis mirer, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:22:82" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 3, 22, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipsi statuerent, quo tempore possent suo jure arma capere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,006:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tull. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut statuerem quid esset faciendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:7:26:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 7, 26, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuere enim qui sit sapiens, vel maxime videtur esse sapientis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 3, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si habes jam statutum quid tibi agendum putes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu quantum tribuendum nobis putes statuas ipse, et, ut spero, statues ex nostrā dignitate,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 8, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix statui posse utrum quae pro se, an quae contra fratrem petiturus esset ab senatu magis impetrabilia forent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:19:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 19, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam satis statuerat, utram foveret partem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:29:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 29, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">posse ipsam Liviam statuere, nubendum post Drusum, an, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statue quem poenae extrahas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Troad. 661" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Troad. 661</bibl></cit>.—So with apud animum, <hi rend="ital">to make up one's mind</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vix statuere apud animum meum possum atrum pejor ipsa res an pejore exemplo agatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:34:2:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 34, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proinde ipsi primum statuerent apud animos quid vellent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:39:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 39, 11</bibl></cit>.—Rarely with <hi rend="ital">neutr</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pron.</hi> as object: <cit><quote lang="la">quidquid nos de communi sententiā statuerimus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:1:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 4, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic statue, quidquid statuis, ut causam famamque tuam in arto stare scias,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Herc. Fur. 1306" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Herc. Fur. 1306</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.36" n="D" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To decree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">order</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prescribe.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45294.37" n="1" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: statuunt ut decem milia hominum in oppidum submittantur,<pb n="1754" /> <cb n="STAT" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos (Siculos) statuisse ut hoc quod dico postularet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:42:section=103" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 42, § 103</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuunt illi atque decernunt ut eae litterae ... removerentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 71</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">173: statuit iste ut arator  ... vadimonium promitteret,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 15</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">38: orare patres ut statuerent ne absentium nomina reciperentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 42</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">103: statuitur ne post M. Brutum proconsulem sit Creta provincia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:38:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 2, 38, 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Tiberius) auxit patrum honorem statuendo ut qui ad senatum provocavissent, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuiturque (a senatu) ut ... in servitute haberentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 53</bibl></cit>.—So of a decree, determination, or agreement by several persons or parties to be carried out by each of them: <cit><quote lang="la">statutum esse (inter plebem et Poenos) ut ... impedimenta diriperent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:23:16:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 23, 16, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Athenienses cum statuerent, ut urbe relictā naves conscenderent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:11:48" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 3, 11, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuunt ut fallere custodes tentent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:84" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 84</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n45294.38" n="2" level="3"> With <case>acc.</case> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">remedium statuere,</quote> <trans><tr>to prescribe a remedy against public abuses</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 28</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 4</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar ducentesimam (vectigalis) in posterum statuit,</quote> <trans><tr>decreed that one half of one per cent. be the tax</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 42</bibl></cit>.—So with <hi rend="ital">sic</hi> (= hoc): <cit><quote lang="la">sic, di, statuistis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:661" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 661</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.39" n="3" level="3"> With <case>dat.</case> and <case>acc.</case> (not ante-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">eis (Vestalibus) stipendium de publico statuit,</quote> <trans><tr>decreed</tr>, <tr>allowed a salary</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aurelio quoque annuam pecuniam statuit princeps,</quote> <trans><tr>decreed</tr>, <tr>granted</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:13:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 13, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">biduum criminibus obiciendis statuitur,</quote> <trans><tr>are allowed</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">itaque et alimenta pueris statuta ... et patribus praemia statuta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:4:8" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 4, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ceu Aeolus insanis statuat certamina ventis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:300" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 300</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non hoc statui sub tempore rebus occasum Aeoniis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 219</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuere alicui munera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:2:566" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 2, 566</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.40" n="4" level="3"> With <case>dat.</case> and <hi rend="ital">interrog.-clause</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cur his quoque statuisti quantum ex hoc genere frumenti darent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:21:section=53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 21, § 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ordo iis quo quisque die supplicarent, statutus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:28:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 28, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.41" n="5" level="3"> In partic., of punishment, etc., <hi rend="ital">to decree</hi>, <hi rend="ital">measure out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">inflict.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45294.42" n="(a)" level="5"> With poenam, etc., with or without <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc. pers.</hi> (mostly post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">considerando ... in utrā (lege) major poena statuatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:2:49:145" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Inv. 2, 49, 145</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poenam statui par fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui non judicium, sed poenam statui videbant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eadem poena in Catum Firmium statuitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senatu universo in socios facinoris ultimam statuente poenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:14" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 14</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so with mercedem (= poenam): debuisse gravissimam temeritatis mercedem statui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:55:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 55, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">also: Thrasea, non quidquid nocens reus pati mereretur, id egregio sub principe statuendum disseruit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:14:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 14, 48</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">non debere eripi patribus vim statuendi (sc. poenas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:3:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 3, 70</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.43" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">indef. obj.</hi>, generally with <hi rend="ital">in</hi> and <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: aliquid gravius in aliquem, <hi rend="ital">to proceed severely against</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">obsecrare coepit, ne quid gravius in fratrem statueret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fac aliquid gravius in Hejum statuisse Mamertinos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:9:section=19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 9, § 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">res monet cavere ab illis magis quam quid in illos statuamus consultare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 52:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 52, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui cum triste aliquid statuit, fit tristis et ipse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:2:119" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 2, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si quid ob eam rem de se crudelius statuerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:15:10" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 15, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.44" n="(g)" level="5"> With a word expressing the kind of punishment (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">in Pompeiam Sabinam exilium statuitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:6:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 6, 24</bibl></cit> (18).—</sense><sense id="n45294.45" n="(d)" level="5"> De capite, <hi rend="ital">to pass sentence of death</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">legem illam praeclaram quae de capite civis Romani nisi comitiis centuriatis statui vetaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:2:36:61" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 2, 36, 61</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.46" n="E" level="2"> Referring to one's own acts, <hi rend="ital">to resolve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determine</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to propose</hi>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> (first in Cic.; <cit><quote lang="la">freq. and class.): statuit ab initio et in eo perseveravit, jus publicano non dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 5, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">P. Clodius cum statuisset omni scelere in praeturā vexare rem publicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 9, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuerat excusare,</quote> <trans><tr>to decline the office</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,033:7:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Lig. 7, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum statuissem scribere ad te aliquid,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 2, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod iste certe statuerat et deliberaverat non adesse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:1:section=1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 1, § 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se statuisse animum advertere in omnes nauarchos,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 40</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">105: nam statueram in perpetuum tacere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:4:4:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 4, 4, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statueram ... nihil de illo dicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,062:Clod. 1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fragm. Clod. 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statueram rectā Appiā Romam (i. e. venire),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:16:10:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 16, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Pompeius statuerat bello decertare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 86</bibl></cit>: si cedere hinc statuisset,<cb n="STAT" />  <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:39:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 39, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">triumphare mense Januario statuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">immemor sim propositi quo statui non ultra attingere externa nisi qua Romanis cohaererent rebus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:48" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 48</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex quamquam dissimulare statuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 21</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">opperiri ibi hostium adventum statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:54:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 42, 54, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut statuisse non pugnare consules cognitum est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:45:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 45, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exaugurare fana statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:55:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 55, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Delphos mittere statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:56:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 56, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eos deducere in agros statuerunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:40:38:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 40, 38, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tradere se, ait, moenia statuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:25:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 25, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Samnitium exercitus certamine ultimo fortunam experiri statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:37:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 37, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuit sic adfectos hosti non obicere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:36:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 44, 36, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sub idem tempus statuit senatus Carthaginem excidere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:12:2" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statui pauca disserere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:4:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 4, 73</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amoliri juvenem specie honoris statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 2, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuerat urbem novam condere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:8:1" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 8, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuerat parcere urbi conditae a Cyro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:6:20" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 6, 20</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex statuerat inde abire,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:11:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexander statuerat ex Syriā petere Africam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:1:17" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 17</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:10:5:24" default="NO">10, 5, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:27" default="NO">5, 27</bibl> (9), 13; so, <cit><quote lang="la">statutum habere cum animo ac deliberatum,</quote> <trans><tr>to have firmly and deliberately resolved</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:41:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 41, § 95</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">sic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">caedis initium fecisset a me, sic enim statuerat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:7:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 3, 7, 29</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.47" n="F" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">To judge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">declare as a judgment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">be of opinion</hi>, <hi rend="ital">hold</hi> (especially of legal opinions), <hi rend="ital">think</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi> (always implying the establishment of a principle, or a decided conviction; cf.: existimo, puto, etc.). </sense><sense id="n45294.48" n="1" level="3"> With <case>acc.</case> and <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45294.49" n="a" level="4"> In gen.: <cit><quote lang="la">senatus consulta falsa delata ab eo judicavimus ... leges statuimus per vim et contra auspicia latas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:12:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 12, 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuit senatus hoc ne illi quidem esse licitum cui concesserat omnia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:35:section=81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 35, § 81</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quin is tamen (judex) statuat fieri non posse ut de isto non severissime judicetur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 3, 62</bibl></cit>, § <cit><quote lang="la">144: hujusce rei vos (recuperatores) statuetis nullam esse actionem qui obstiterit armatis hominibus?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:13:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 13, 39</bibl></cit>, ut quisquam juris numeretur peritus, qui id statuit esse jus quod non oporteat judicari, <hi rend="ital">who holds that to be the law</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 24, 68</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">is (Pompeius) se in publico statuit esse non posse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:13:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pis. 13, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu unquam tantam plagam tacitus accipere potuisses, nisi hoc ita statuisses, quidquid dixisses te deterius esse facturum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:58:section=133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 58, § 133</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si causa cum causā contenderet, nos nostram perfacile cuivis probaturos statuebamus,</quote> <trans><tr>we were sure</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 30, 92</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non statuit sibi quidquam licere quod non patrem suum facere vidisset,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:90:section=211" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 90, § 211</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hi sibi nullam societatem communis utilitatis causā statuunt esse cum civibus,</quote> <trans><tr>assume</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:6:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 6, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum igitur statuisset opus esse ad eam rem constituendam pecuniā,</quote> <trans><tr>had become convinced</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 23, 82</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quo cive neminem ego statuo in hac re publicā esse fortiorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:21:51" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Planc. 21, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quam quidem laudem sapientiae statuo esse maximam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:13:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc anno statuit temporis esse satis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:34" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nolim statuas me mente malignā id facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:67:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 67, 37</bibl></cit>.— So with <hi rend="ital">sic</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">velim sic statuas tuas mihi litteras longissimas quasque gratissimas fore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:7:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 7, 33 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ego sic statuo a me in hac causā pietatis potius quam defensionis partes esse susceptas,</quote> <trans><tr>I hold</tr>, <tr>lay down as the principle of my defence</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod sic statuit omnino consularem legem nullam putare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 64, 135</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sic statuo et judico, neminem tot et tanta habuisse ornamenta dicendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:2:28:122" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 2, 28, 122</bibl></cit>. —Hence, statui, <hi rend="ital">I have judged</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">I know</hi>, and statueram, <hi rend="ital">I had judged</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">I knew</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ego qui in te satis consilii statuerim esse, mallem Peducaeum tibi consilium dare quam me, ironically,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 1, 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui saepe audissent, nihil esse pulchrius quam Syracusarum moenia, statuerant se, si ea Verre praetore non vidissent, numquam esse visuros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:5:36:section=95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 5, 36, § 95</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">neutr. pron.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si dicam non recte aliquid statuere eos qui consulantur,</quote> <trans><tr>that they hold an erroneous opinion</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:24:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 24, 68</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">quis hoc statuit umquam, aut cui concedi potest, ut eum jure potuerit occidere a quo, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,006:24:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Tull. 24, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:13:21" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 13, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.50" n="b" level="4"> Particularly of a conclusion drawn from circumstances, <hi rend="ital">to judge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">infer</hi>, <hi rend="ital">conclude; declare</hi> (as an inference): <cit><quote lang="la">cum tuto senatum haberi non posse judicavistis, tum statuiistis, etiam intra muros Antonii scelus versari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:3:5:13" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 3, 5, 13</bibl></cit>: quod si aliter statuetis,<cb n="STAT" />  videte ne hoc vos statuatis, qui vivus decesserit, ei vim non esse factam, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 16, 46</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quid? si tu ipse statuisti, bona P. Quinctii ex edicto possessa non esse?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Quint. 24, 76</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ergo ad fidem bonam statuit pertinere notum esse emptori vitium quod nosset venditor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:3:16:67" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 3, 16, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Juppiter esse pium statuit quodcumque juvaret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:4:133" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 4, 133</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">neutr. pron.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc (i. e. litteris Gabinii credendum non esse) statuit senatus cum frequens supplicationem Gabinio denegavit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:6:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Prov. Cons. 6, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod si tum statuit opus esse, quid cum ille decessisset, Flacco existimatis statuendum et faciendum fuisse?</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 12, 29</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:16:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Caecin. 16, 46</bibl>, supra; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hoc si ita statuetis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 16, 47</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.51" n="c" level="4"> Esp. with <hi rend="ital">gerund.-clause.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45294.52" n="(a)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To hold</hi>, <hi rend="ital">judge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">think</hi>, <hi rend="ital">consider</hi>, <hi rend="ital">acknowledge</hi>, <hi rend="ital">that something must be done</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">should have been done</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">tu cum tuos amicos in provinciam quasi in praedam invitabas ... non statuebas tibi de illorum factis rationem esse reddendam?</quote> <trans><tr>did you not consider</tr>, <tr>did it not strike you?</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:11:section=29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 11, § 29</bibl></cit>: statuit, si hoc crimen extenuari vellet, nauarchos omnes vitā esse privandos, <hi rend="ital">he thought it necessary to deprive</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 40</bibl>, § <cit><quote lang="la">103: ut statuas mihi non modo non cedendum, sed etiam tuo auxilio utendum fuisse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuebam sic, boni nihil ab illis nugis expectandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:10:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 10, 24</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Antigonus statuit aliquid sibi consilii novi esse capiendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,018:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Eum. 8, 4</bibl></cit>. —So with opus fuisse: <cit><quote lang="la">ut hoc statuatis oratione longā nihil opus fuisse,</quote> <trans><tr>acknowledge</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:18:56" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 1, 18, 56</bibl></cit>: causam sibi dicendam esse statuerat jam ante quam hoc usu venit, <hi rend="ital">knew</hi> (cf. a. supra), <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 5, 39</bibl>, § 101. —</sense><sense id="n45294.53" n="(b)" level="5"> <hi rend="ital">To think that one must do something</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to resolve</hi>, <hi rend="ital">propose</hi>, usu. with <hi rend="ital">dat. pers.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manendum mihi statuebam quasi in vigiliā quādam consulari ac senatoriā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:1:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 1, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: quae vobis fit injuria si statuimus, vestro nobis judicio standum esse, <hi rend="ital">if we conclude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">purpose</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to abide</hi>, etc., <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fl. 27, 65</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut ea quae statuisses tibi in senatu dicenda, reticeres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:5:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 5, 2, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuit tamen nihil sibi in tantis injuriis gravius faciendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:6:16" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Clu. 6, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Caesar statuit exspectandam classem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:3:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 3, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non expectandum sibi statuit dum, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod eo tempore statuerat non esse faciendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 3, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuit sibi nihil agitandum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 39:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 39, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Metellus statuit alio more bellum gerendum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:ib. 54:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 54, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Laco statuit accuratius sibi agendum cum Pharnabazo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Alcib. 10:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Alcib. 10, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sororis filios tollendos statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:38:1" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 38, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.54" n="2" level="3"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si, ut Manilius statuebat, sic est judicatum (= ut judicandum esse statuebat),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,008:24:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Caecin. 24, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut veteres statuerunt poetae (ut = quod ita esse),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,060:chapter=267" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Arat. 267</bibl></cit> (33): quae majora auribus accepta sunt quam oculis noscuntur, ut statuit, <hi rend="ital">as he thought</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">that those things were greater</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:45:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 45, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum esset, ut ego mihi statuo, talis qualem te esse video,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 14, 32</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45294.55" n="3" level="3"> With two <case>acc.</case> (= duco, existimo): <cit><quote lang="la">omnes qui libere de re publicā sensimus, statuit ille quidem non inimicos, sed hostes,</quote> <trans><tr>regarded not as adversaries</tr>, <tr>but as foes</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:11:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 11, 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Anaximenes aëra deum statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:10:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> N. D. 10, 26</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">voluptatem summum bonum statuens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">video Lentulum cujus ego parentem deum ac patronum statuo fortunae ac nominis mei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:69:144" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 69, 144</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">si rectum statuerimus concedere amicis quidquid velint,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,052:11:38" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Lael. 11, 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Hieronymus summum bonum statuit non dolere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:2:6:19" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 2, 6, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">noster vero Plato Titanum e genere statuit eos qui ... adversentur magistratibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:2:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 2, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decretum postulat, quo justae inter patruos fratrumque filias nuptiae statuerentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:12:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 12, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">optimum in praesentiā statuit reponere odium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,001:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 39</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">P. a.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stătūtus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, i. e. baculo, <hi rend="ital">propped</hi>, <hi rend="ital">leaning</hi> on a stick (dub. v. I. C. supra): <cit><quote lang="la">vidistis senem ... statutum, ventriosum?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,017:2:2:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Rud. 2, 2, 11</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stă-tūtum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">a law</hi>, <hi rend="ital">decision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">determination</hi>, <hi rend="ital">statute</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">Dei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Lact.</author> 2, 16, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Parcarum leges ac statuta,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 14</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statuta Dei et placita,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 25, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
statura: <entryFree id="n45295" type="main" key="sta^tu_ra"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătūra</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>status, from sto; prop. a standing upright, an upright posture; hence</etym>, <sense id="n45295.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">height</hi> or <hi rend="ital">size</hi> of the body, <hi rend="ital">stature.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45295.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">(vir) commodā staturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:2:3:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 2, 3, 21</bibl></cit>: staturā haud magnā, id. <pb n="1755" /> <cb n="STAT" /> Poen. 5, 2, 152: pro facie, pro staturā, Lucil. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 226, 25</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">velim mihi dicas, L. Turselius quā facie fuerit, quā staturā, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:16:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 16, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corporis nostri partes totaque figura et forma et statura, quam apta ad naturam sit, apparet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:5:12:35" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 5, 12, 35</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">corporis (corresp. to figura),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,036:1:28:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Inv. 1, 28, 41</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ipse (citharoedus) formā et specie sit et staturā appositā ad dignitatem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Auct. Her.</author> 4, 47, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parva statura (hominis),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>ib.</author> 4, 33, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">homines tantulae staturae,</quote> <trans><tr>of so small a stature</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:2:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 2, 30 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hoc ali staturam, ali hoc vires,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 6, 21</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n45295.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of animals or plants, <hi rend="ital">size</hi>, <hi rend="ital">growth</hi> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">Altinae vaccae sunt humilis staturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:6:24:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 6, 24, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">producere vitem in tantam staturam, quantam permittit agricola,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:5:8" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 5, 8</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
staturosus: <entryFree id="n45296" type="main" key="sta^tu_ro_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătūrōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype> <etym>statura</etym>, <sense id="n45296.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of great stature</hi>, <hi rend="ital">gigantic</hi>, Aug. Civ. Dei, 15, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
status: <entryFree id="n45297" type="main" key="sta^tus1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. sisto.</entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45298" type="main" key="sta^tus2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stătus</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>sto and sisto</etym>. <sense id="n45298.0" n="I" level="1"> In a corporeal sense. </sense><sense id="n45298.1" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Mode</hi> or <hi rend="ital">way of standing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of holding one's body</hi> (at rest), <hi rend="ital">posture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">position</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attitude</hi>, <hi rend="ital">station</hi>, <hi rend="ital">carriage; sing.</hi> and <hi rend="ital">plur.: Ps.</hi> Statur hic ad hunc modum. <hi rend="ital">Si.</hi> Statum vide hominis, Callipho, quasi basilicum, <hi rend="ital">look at the way he stands</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 41</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stat in statu senex ut adoriatur moechum,</quote> <trans><tr>in an attitude of attack</tr>, <tr>ready</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:4:9:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 4, 9, 12</bibl></cit>: concrepuit digitis, laborat; <cit><quote lang="la">crebro conmutat status,</quote> <trans><tr>his posture</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 2, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui esset status (videre vellem) flabellulum tenere te asinum tantum,</quote> <trans><tr>what your attitude was</tr>, <tr>what figure you cut</tr>, <tr>in holding the fan</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:3:5:50" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 3, 5, 50</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in gestu status (oratoris erit) erectus et celsus, rarus incessus,</quote> <trans><tr>attitude</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:18:59" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 18, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">status quidem rectus sit, sed diducti paulum pedes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:159" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 159</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">abesse plurimum a saltatore debet orator ... non effingere status quosdam, et quidquid dicet ostendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:89" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 11, 3, 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut recta sint bracchia, ne indoctae rusticaeve manus, ne status indecorus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:11:16" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 11, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stare solitus Socrates dicitur ... immobilis, iisdem in vestigiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:2:1:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 2, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dumque silens astat, status est vultusque diserti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:2:5:51" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 2, 5, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">statum proeliantis componit,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 95 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>— <cit><quote lang="la">So of the pose of statues: non solum numerum signorum, sed etiam uniuscujusque magnitudinem, figuram, statum litteris definiri vides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:1:21:section=57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 1, 21, § 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">expedit saepe, ut in statuis atque picturis videmus, variari habitus, vultus, status,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:8" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ut illo statu Chabrias sibi statuam fieri voluerit. Ex quo factum est ut postea athletae his statibus in statuis ponendis uterentur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Chabr. 1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Chabr. 1, 3</bibl></cit>.—And of images in a dream: <cit><quote lang="la">ubi prima (imago somni) perit, alioque est altera nata inde statu, prior hic gestum mutasse videtur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:772" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 772</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(opp. motus, incessus) quorum (iratorum) vultus, voces, motus statusque mutantur,</quote> <trans><tr>motions and postures</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:29:102" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 1, 29, 102</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">decorum istud in corporis motu et statu cernitur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 35, 126</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">habitus oris et vultūs, status, motus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:17:56" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Fin. 3, 17, 56</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 17, 47</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">in quibus si peccetur ... motu statuve deformi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 12, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">eo erant vultu, oratione, omni reliquo motu et statu, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:22:53" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 3, 22, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">status, incessus, sessio, accubatio ... teneat illud decorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:1:35:129" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Off. 1, 35, 129</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in pedibus observentur status et incessus,</quote> <trans><tr>the posture and gait</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:11:3:124" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 11, 3, 124</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45298.2" n="B" level="2"> Of external appearance, <hi rend="ital">manners</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dress</hi>, and <hi rend="ital">apparel</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">quoniam formam hujus cepi in me et statum, decet et facta moresque hujus habere me similis item,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,001:1:1:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Am. 1, 1, 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">redegitque se ad pallium et crepidas, atque in tali statu biennio fere permansit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:13" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Tib. 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45298.3" n="C" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">Size</hi>, <hi rend="ital">height</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stature</hi> of living and inanimate beings (cf. statura; <cit><quote lang="la">post-Aug.): pumilionem, quos natura brevi statu peractos, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:6:58" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 6, 58</bibl></cit>: longissimum ... aratorem faciemus;
