stercus: <entryFree id="n45350" type="main" key="stercus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stercus</orth>, <itype>ŏris</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">skw/r</foreign>; <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi> <foreign lang="greek">skato/s</foreign>, dung; Sanscr. cakrt = sakart</etym>. <sense id="n45350.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">dung</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excrements</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ordure</hi> (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">fimus, merda),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:38" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 38</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:15" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 15</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 29</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:27:57" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 27, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:12:11 al" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 12, 11 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=344" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 344</bibl> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 6:section=32" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 6, § 32</bibl> ib., and Fest. s. v. Quando stercus, pp. 258 and 259 ib.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:14:64" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 14, 64</bibl>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">aurum in stercore quaerere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cassiod.</author> Inst. Div. Lit. 1, p. 510</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45350.1" n="b" level="4"> As a term of abuse: <cit><quote lang="la">nolo stercus curiae dici Glauciam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:41:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 41, 164</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45350.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">ferri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>dross</tr>, <tr>slag</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 188" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 188</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stercutius: <entryFree id="n45351" type="main" key="Stercu^ti^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stercŭtĭus</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stercŭtus</orth>, v. Sterculius.</entryFree>
sterelytis: <entryFree id="n45352" type="greek" key="sterely_tis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sterelȳtis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45352.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sort of scum</hi> or <hi rend="ital">litharge of silver</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 35, § 108</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stereobata: <entryFree id="n45353" type="greek" key="ste^re^o^ba^ta"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĕrĕŏbăta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stereoba/ths</foreign>, <sense id="n45353.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pedestal</hi> of a column or row of columns, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 3, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stergethron: <entryFree id="n45354" type="greek" key="sterge_thron"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stergēthron</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">ste/rghqron</foreign>, <sense id="n45354.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a plant</hi>, <hi rend="ital">great houseleek</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:160" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 13, 102, § 160</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 123</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
steria: <entryFree id="n45355" type="main" key="Ste_ria"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stēria</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*steiri/a</foreign>, <sense id="n45355.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a town in Attica</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 7, 11, § 24</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stericula: <entryFree id="n45356" type="hapax" key="ste_ri^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stērĭcŭla</orth>, ae. <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl>, <sense id="n45356.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the uterus of a sow that has not yet farrowed</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 35, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sterigmos: <entryFree id="n45357" type="greek" key="ste_rigmos"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stērigmos</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sthrigmo/s</foreign>, <sense id="n45357.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the standing-still of a planet</hi> (pure Lat. stativa lux), App. de Mundo, p. 64, 25.</sense></entryFree>
sterilefio: <entryFree id="n45358" type="hapax" key="ste^ri^le^fi_o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĕrĭlĕfīo</orth>, <itype>fĭĕri</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>sterilis-facio</etym>, <sense id="n45358.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to become unfruitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barren</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">sterile</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">leaenae sterilefiunt in aeternum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sol.</author> 27 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl></cit> dub. (al. steriles fiunt).</sense></entryFree>
sterilesco: <entryFree id="n45359" type="main" key="ste^ri^lesco"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĕrĭlesco</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <sense id="n45359.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. inch. n.</hi> [sterilis], <hi rend="ital">to grow unfruitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barren</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">sterile.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45359.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">leaenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 16, 17, § 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caprae pinguitudine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:200" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 50, 76, § 200</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amygdalae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:63" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 10, 11, § 63</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mamma (suis),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:11:234" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 11, 40, 95, § 234</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45359.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: gaudia, Val. <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, Dir. 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sterilicula: <entryFree id="n45360" type="main" key="ste^ri^li^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĕrĭlĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = vulva sterilis, <sense id="n45360.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the womb of a sow that has never borne young</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 35, 3</bibl>. <cb n="STER" /></sense></entryFree>
sterilis: <entryFree id="n45361" type="main" key="ste^ri^lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĕrĭlis</orth>, <itype>e</itype> (collat. form, <sense id="n45361.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">acc. sing. fem</hi> sterilam sterilem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1236,001:page=316" default="NO"><author>Fest.</author> p. 316</bibl> Müll.; <hi rend="ital">neutr. plur.</hi> sterila, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:845" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 845</bibl>; <case>abl.</case> sterile, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2003,001:7:1:section=258" default="NO"><author>Apic.</author> 7, 1, § 258</bibl>), <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>Gr. <foreign lang="greek">stereo/s</foreign>, hard; <foreign lang="greek">steri/fh, stei=ra</foreign>, barren; Sanscr. starī, vacca sterilis</etym>, <hi rend="ital">unfruitful</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barren</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sterile</hi>, of plants and animals (class. and very freq.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn infecundus): steriles nascuntur avenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:5:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 5, 37</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">ulvae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:299" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 299</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">herba,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:3:7:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 3, 7, 31</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:21" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 21</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">platani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agri,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 84</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:141" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 3, 141</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">tellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:789" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 789</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">palus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 65</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harena,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">humus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:2" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 2</bibl></cit> (2, 11), 2; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:5:34" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 5, 34</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:3:4:3" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">steriles nimium crasso sunt semine,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1240" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1240</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:67:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 67, 26</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">galli Tanagric' ad partus sunt steriliores,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 3:9:6" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 3, 9, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vacca,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multae (mulie res),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1251" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1251</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viri,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>eunuchs</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 69</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:78" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 10, 47, § 78</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:9:9:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 9, 9, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ova,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:166" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 60, 80, § 166</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45361.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; not in Cic.). </sense><sense id="n45361.2" n="1" level="3"> Of things, <hi rend="ital">causing unfruitfulness</hi> or <hi rend="ital">sterility</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubigo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:23:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 23, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">frigus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:4:108" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 4, 108</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hiems,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:8:68:10" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 8, 68, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">serere pampinariis sterile est,</quote> <trans><tr>produces sterility</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:157" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 21, 35, § 157</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45361.3" n="2" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">barren</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">empty</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">manus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:1:2:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sterilis amator a datis,</quote> <trans><tr>bare of gifts</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 1, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amicus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:12:97" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 12, 97</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:18:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 18, 3</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">epistulae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 2, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">saeculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 5:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">civitas ad aquas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 1, p. 106 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vadum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest. 173" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest. 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpora sonitu (with jejuna succo),</quote> <trans><tr>that yield no sound</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:845" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 845</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">prospectus,</quote> <trans><tr>without human beings</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:1:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 3, 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">domus,</quote> <trans><tr>without children</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl></cit> (5), 11, 62: <cit><quote lang="la">nummi,</quote> <trans><tr>that do not bear interest</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:22:1:7" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 22, 1, 7</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sterilis laurus baccarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:130" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 30, 39, § 130</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides plumbi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 7, 40, § 119</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45361.4" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">unproductive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unprofitable</hi>, <hi rend="ital">fruitless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">useless</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vain</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Februarius,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,058:2:12:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Q. Fr. 2, 12, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod monumentum, quod immo temporis punctum, aut beneficio sterile, aut vacuum laude?</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:56:2" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 56, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne sit sterile et effetum (saeculum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:17:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ep. 5, 17, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fama (with cassa),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:6:70" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 6, 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">labor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:58:8" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 58, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pax,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">amor,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>unreturned</tr>, <tr>unrequited</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:496" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 496</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:4:42" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 4, 42</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cathedrae,</quote> <trans><tr>unprofitable</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:1:76:14" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 1, 76, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:203" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 7, 203</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">litus sterili versamus aratro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:7:49" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 49</bibl></cit>.—With <hi rend="ital">gen.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">destitute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">deprived of</hi>, <hi rend="ital">unacquainted with</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">urbes talium studiorum fuere steriles,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:18" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 18 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non adeo virtutum sterile saeculum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">heu steriles veri!</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:75" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 5, 75</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sterilitas: <entryFree id="n45362" type="main" key="ste^ri^li^tas"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĕrĭlĭtas</orth>, <itype>ātis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>sterilis</etym>, <sense id="n45362.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">unfruitfulness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">barrenness</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sterility</hi> (class.). </sense><sense id="n45362.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae sit vel sterilitas agrorum vel fertilitas futura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:57:131" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 57, 131</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:26:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Agr. 2, 26, 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">frugum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 1 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:111" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 26, 47, § 111</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">annonae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:10:1" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 10, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vitium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:10:15" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 10, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">terrae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Thren. 4, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fetus exstitit in sterilitate naturae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:1:18:36" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 1, 18, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mulierum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:97" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 28, 8, 27, § 97</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sterilitatem castrare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 18, 14, 36, § 136</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cl.:18" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Claud. 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">continuae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:10:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 10, 8</bibl></cit> (24), 5.—* </sense><sense id="n45362.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">caelestis sterilitas,</quote> <trans><tr>weather that causes unfruitfulness</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:18:290" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 18, 29, 69, § 290</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sterilitas fortunae,</quote> <trans><tr>poverty</tr>, <tr>insufficiency</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 14</bibl></cit>, prooem. § 4.—* </sense><sense id="n45362.3" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">in sterilitatem emarcuit (auctoritas),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:15:121" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 15, 29, 36, § 121</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sterilus: <entryFree id="n45363" type="main" key="ste^ri^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĕrĭlus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, v. sterilis <sense id="n45363.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sternax: <entryFree id="n45364" type="main" key="sternax"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sternax</orth>, <itype>ācis</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>sterno</etym>, <sense id="n45364.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">that throws to the ground</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">equus,</quote> <trans><tr>that throws his rider</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 364</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:1:261" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 1, 261</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cives,</quote> <trans><tr>that fall prostrate</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 5, 14 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">so of a suppliant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 12</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sterno: <entryFree id="n45365" type="main" key="sterno"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sterno</orth>, <itype>strāvi, strātum, 3</itype> (<sense id="n45365.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">pluperf.</hi> sync. strarat, <bibl default="NO"><author>Manil.</author> 1, 774</bibl>: strasset, Varr. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 86, 8</bibl>), <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>Gr. root <foreign lang="greek">*s*t*o*r, store/nnumi</foreign>, to spread; <foreign lang="greek">strato/s</foreign>, camp; Sanscr. star- strnāmi = sterno; cf.: strages, struo, torus, and <itype>lātus</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, old Lat. stlatus</etym>, <hi rend="ital">to spread out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread abroad; to stretch out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extend.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45365.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in postAug. prose; in Cic. only in the <hi rend="ital">part. perf.;</hi> cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">effundo, extendo, subicio, subdo): vestes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:658" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 658</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in duro vellus solo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:654" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 4, 654</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">bubulos utres ponte,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:176" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 29, 34, § 176</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hic glarea dura Sternitur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:60" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 60</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">natas sub aequore virgas Sternit,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>scatters</tr>, <tr>strews</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:743" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 743</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harenam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:813" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 3, 813</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:2:14:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 2, 14, 8</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">herbas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:7:254" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> M. 7, 254</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">poma passim,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:7:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> E. 7, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">spongeas ad lunam et pruinas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:31:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 31, 11</bibl></cit>. <pb n="1758" /> <cb n="STER" /> 47, § <cit><quote lang="la">123: arma per flores,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Grat.</author> Cyneg. 487</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fessi sternunt corpora,</quote> <trans><tr>stretch out their bodies</tr>, <tr>lie down</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:47:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 47, 9</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">sternunt se somno diversae in litore phocae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:432" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 4, 432</bibl></cit>.—Mid.: <cit><quote lang="la">sternimur optatae gremio telluris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:509" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 509</bibl></cit>; and: <cit><quote lang="la">in Capitolinas certatim scanditur arces Sternunturque Jovi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:340" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 340</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Part. perf.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">strātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">stretched out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">lying down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prostrate</hi> (syn. prostratus): strata terrae, Enn. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Non.</author> 172, 20</bibl> (Trag. v. 370 Vahl.): <cit><quote lang="la">nos humi strati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:3:6:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 3, 6, 22</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam somno etiam strati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:20:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 20, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad pedes strati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:10:4:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 10, 4, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stratum jacere et genua complecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:6:1:34" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 6, 1, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc viridi membra sub arbuto Stratus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:1:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 1, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45365.2" n="2" level="3"> Of places, <hi rend="ital">to extend</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">insulae Frisiorum, Chaucorum, etc. ... sternuntur inter Helium ac Flevum,</quote> <trans><tr>stretch out</tr>, <tr>extend</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:4:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 4, 15, 29, § 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:3:60" default="NO" valid="yes">3, 5, 9, § 60</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">hence, vites stratae,</quote> <trans><tr>spreading</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:4:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 5, 4, 2</bibl></cit> (for <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:5:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Milt. 5, 3</bibl>, v. under rarus, II. A.).—</sense><sense id="n45365.3" n="B" level="2"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">to spread</hi> a thing <hi rend="ital">out flat</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to smooth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">level</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>): <cit><quote lang="la">sternere aequor aquis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 89</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">placidi straverunt aequora venti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 5, 763</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nunc omne tibi stratum silet aequor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,001:9:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> E. 9, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pontum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:11:501" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 11, 501</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:125" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 47, 47, § 125</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stratoque super discumbitur ostro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:700" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 1, 700</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam per mare,</quote> <trans><tr>smoothed</tr>, <tr>levelled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1030" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1030</bibl></cit> (acc. to the Gr. <foreign lang="greek">o(do\n store/nnumi</foreign>): <cit><quote lang="la">stratum militari labore iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:13:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 2, 13, 16</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">hoc iter Alpes, Hoc Cannae stravere tibi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:514" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 514</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">and trop.: praesens tibi fama benignum Stravit iter,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:813" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 813</bibl></cit>.—* </sense><sense id="n45365.4" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (the figure borrowed from the sea), <hi rend="ital">to calm</hi>, <hi rend="ital">still</hi>, <hi rend="ital">moderate</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">odia militum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 58</bibl></cit> (cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">constrata ira,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:2:5:1" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 2, 5, 1</bibl></cit>).—</sense><sense id="n45365.5" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45365.6" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cover over</hi> (by spreading something out; the predom. class. signif. of the word; cf. obtendo). </sense><sense id="n45365.7" n="1" level="3"> Of a couch, bed, etc., <hi rend="ital">to spread</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prepare</hi>, <hi rend="ital">arrange</hi>, <hi rend="ital">make</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lectus vestimentis stratus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 30</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">strata cubilia sunt herbis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:1417" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 1417</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rogatus est a Maximo, ut triclinium sterneret ... Atque ille stravit pelliculis haedinis lectulos Punicanos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:36:75" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 36, 75</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">lectum, lectos, biclinium, triclinia, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,018:2:2:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Stich. 2, 2, 33</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:4:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Most. 1, 4, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:2:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Men. 2, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 70</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:2:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ps. 1, 2, 31</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:1:1:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 1, 1, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,006:2:4:21" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Ad. 2, 4, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,010:5:14" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Clu. 5, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:5:21:61" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tusc. 5, 21, 61</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:51" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 51</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">his foliis cubitus sternere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:24:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 24, 9, 38, § 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">torum frondibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:5" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strata cathedra,</quote> <trans><tr>cushioned</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:9:52" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 9, 52</bibl></cit>; cf. also, ARCERAM NE STERNITO, Fragm. XII. Tab. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:20:1:25" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 20, 1, 25</bibl>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">jubet sterni sibi in primā domus parte (sc. lectum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:27:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 27, 7</bibl></cit>.— </sense><sense id="n45365.8" n="2" level="3"> Esp., places, <hi rend="ital">to cover;</hi> of a way, road, path, etc., <hi rend="ital">to pave</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aspreta erant strata saxis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:9:35:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 9, 35, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">via strata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:15:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 8, 15, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">semitam saxo quadrato straverunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:10:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 10, 23 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">vias silice ... clivum Capitolinum silice ... emporium lapide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:41:27:5 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 41, 27, 5 sq.</bibl></cit>; and <hi rend="ital">absol.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">locum illum sternendum locare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:14:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Att. 14, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pavimentum stratum lapide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,053:40:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Ezech. 40, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">viam lapide,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:43:11:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 43, 11, 1</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45365.9" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">To saddle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:20:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 20, 12</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:20:4" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 20, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 5, 77</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">asinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,001:22:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gen. 22, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45365.10" n="4" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to cover</hi>, <hi rend="ital">spread</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">argento sternunt iter omne viarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:626" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 626</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">foliis nemus Multis et algā litus inutili tempestas Sternet,</quote> <trans><tr>will strew over</tr>, <tr>bestrew</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:3:17:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 3, 17, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">congeriem silvae vellere summam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:236" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 236</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">litora nive,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:5:175" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 5, 175</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">harenam Circi chrysocolla,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 5, 27, § 90</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solum telis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:9:666" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 9, 666</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Tyrrhenas valles caedibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:6:602" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 6, 602</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strati bacis silvestribus agri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:2:183" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 2, 183</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ante aras terram caesi stravere juvenci,</quote> <trans><tr>covered</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:719" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 8, 719</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45365.11" n="B" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">To stretch out by flinging down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to throw down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stretch on the ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throw to the ground</hi>, <hi rend="ital">overthrow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">prostrate</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>, esp. in Verg.; in prose not before the Aug. period; in Cic. only once in the trop. sense; <xr><lbl>v.</lbl> <ref type="sym" targOrder="U">the foll.</ref></xr>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">profligo): cujus casus prolapsi cum proximos sterneret,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 5, 47</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">circa jacentem ducem sterne Gallorum catervas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:26:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 7, 26, 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">turbam invadite ac sternite omnia ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:38:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 24, 38, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alius sit fortis in armis, Sternat et adversos Marte favente duces,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:10:30" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 10, 30</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">caede viros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:119" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 119</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem leto,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 566</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">morte,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 796</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:21:15" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 21, 15</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:604" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 604</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">adversā prensis a fronte capillis Stravit humi pronam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:2:477" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 2, 477</bibl></cit>: primosque et extremos Stravit <cb n="STER" /> humum, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:14:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 14, 32</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sternitur volnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:781" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 781</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">impetus per stratos caede hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:29:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 29, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem morti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:12:464" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 12, 464</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irae Thyesten exitio gravi Stravere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:16:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 16, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">corpore toto Sternitur in vultus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:318" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 318</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sternitur, et toto projectus corpore terrae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:11:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 11, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">toto praecipitem sternit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:182" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 182</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:11:13" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 11, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Ajax stravit ferro pecus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 202</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sternitur et procumbit humi bos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:5:481" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 5, 481</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">strata belua texit humum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:106" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 106</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rapidus torrens Sternit agros, sternit sata laeta,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:306" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 306</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">moenia,</quote> <trans><tr>to overthrow</tr>, <tr>demolish</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:550" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 550</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stratis ariete muris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 29, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sternit a culmine Trojam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:603" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 603</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">(elephanti) stabula Indorum dentibus sternunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:8:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 8, 9, 9, § 27</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45365.12" n="2" level="3"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg> (rare): <cit><quote lang="la">deorum plagā perculsi, afflictos se et stratos esse fatentur,</quote> <trans><tr>cast down</tr>, <tr>prostrated</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:3:29:72" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 3, 29, 72</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mortalia corda Per gentes humiles stravit pavor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:1:331" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> G. 1, 331</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">virtus populi Romani haec omnia strata humi erexit ac sustulit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:41:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 26, 41, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stratā Germaniā,</quote> <trans><tr>subdued</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 16, 1, 5</bibl></cit>.—Hence, <orth extent="full" lang="la">strātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">P. a.;</hi> as <hi rend="ital">substt.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45365.13" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">strāta</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> (sc. via), <hi rend="ital">a paved road</hi> or <hi rend="ital">way</hi> (post-class.), <bibl default="NO"><author>Eutr.</author> 9, 15</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">amplas sternite jam stratas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Juvenc.</author> 1, 315</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in margine stratae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 3, 656</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45365.14" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">strātum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose; not in Cic.; acc. to II. A.).—</sense><sense id="n45365.15" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A bed-covering</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a coverlet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">quilt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">blanket; a pillow</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bolster</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lecti mollia strata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:849" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 849</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">proripere se e strato,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 51</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:5:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 5, 34</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">10, 267</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n45365.16" n="b" level="4"> <usg type="style">Meton.</usg> (pars pro toto), <hi rend="ital">a bed</hi>, <hi rend="ital">couch</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">haud segnis strato surgit Palinurus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:513" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 513</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 8, 415</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">3, 176: tale,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0588,001:Ages. 8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Nep.</author> Ages. 8</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quies neque molli strato neque silentio arcessita,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:4:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 4, 7</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">strataque quae membris intepuere tuis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:10:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 10, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dura,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:2:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Am. 1, 2, 2</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:1:239" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 1, 239</bibl>.—Once also (sc. lectus) in the <hi rend="ital">masc.</hi>, Favorin. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:15:8:2" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 15, 8, 2</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45365.17" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A horsecloth</hi>, <hi rend="ital">housing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a saddle</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 33</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:7:14:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 7, 14, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 80:9" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 80, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:202" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 56, 57, § 202</bibl>. —Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">qui asinum non potest, stratum caedit (v. asinum),</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 45, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45365.18" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A pavement</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">saxea viarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:315" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 315</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:415" default="NO" valid="yes">4, 415</bibl>: extraneum, Petr. poët. 55, 6, 11.</sense></entryFree>
sternumentum: <entryFree id="n45366" type="main" key="sternu_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sternūmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sternuo</etym>, <sense id="n45366.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sneezing</hi> (class.; but cf. sternutamentum). </sense><sense id="n45366.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:40:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 40, 84</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 7, 5, § 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:21:163" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 22, 93, § 163</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:52" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 5, 21, § 52</bibl>; 28, 6, 15, § 57; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:12:5:11" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 12, 5, 11</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:3:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 3, 20</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:4" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:8:9" default="NO" valid="yes">8, 9</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45366.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a means of provoking sneezing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sneezing-powder</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:7:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 7, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:135" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 25, 11, 86, § 135</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:25:173" default="NO" valid="yes">25, 13, 109, § 173</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sternuo: <entryFree id="n45367" type="main" key="sternu^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sternŭo</orth>, <itype>ŭi, 3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n45367.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a.</hi> [cf. Gr. <foreign lang="greek">pta/rnusqai</foreign>, v. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:Griech. Etym. p. 696" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> Griech. Etym. p. 696</bibl>]. </sense><sense id="n45367.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sneeze</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">adorare aliquem, cum sternuerit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 2, 40, 40, § 107</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:57" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 6, 15, § 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:40" default="NO" valid="yes">19, 3, 15, § 40</bibl> (al. sternuto); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:18" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 5, 18</bibl> Schneid. <hi rend="ital">N. cr.</hi>—* </sense><sense id="n45367.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of a light, <hi rend="ital">to sputter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">crackle</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">sternuit et lumen ... sternuit, et nobis prospera signa dedit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:19:151 sq" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> H. 19, 151 sq.</bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n45367.3" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to sneeze out</hi>, <hi rend="ital">give by sneezing</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">omen,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:3:24" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 3, 24</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">approbationem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:45:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 45, 9</bibl></cit> and 18.</sense></entryFree>
sternutamentum: <entryFree id="n45368" type="main" key="sternu_ta_mentum"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sternūtāmentum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>sternuto</etym>, <sense id="n45368.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sneezing</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">sternutamenta erunt observanda,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ira, 2:25:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ira, 2, 25, 4</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:10" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> 10</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,053:2:40:84" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Div. 2, 40, 84</bibl>, the better reading is sternumenta).</sense></entryFree>
sternutatio: <entryFree id="n45369" type="main" key="sternu_ta_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sternūtātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45369.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sneezing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sternutation</hi> (post-class. and rare for sternumentum), <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 9, p. 228, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 10" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 10 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1245,001:Ep. ad M. Caes. 4:5" default="NO"><author>Front.</author> Ep. ad M. Caes. 4, 5 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></sense></entryFree>
sternuto: <entryFree id="n45370" type="main" key="sternu_to"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sternūto</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <sense id="n45370.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. freq. n.</hi> [sternuo], <hi rend="ital">to sneeze</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 98, 4</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">102, 10</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:19:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 19, 3, 15, § 40</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sterope: <entryFree id="n45371" type="main" key="Ste^ro^pe_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stĕrŏpē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*stero/ph</foreign>. <sense id="n45371.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Pleiades</hi>, Att. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 8, 130</bibl> (Trag. Rel. p. 135 Rib.); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:172" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 172</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:11:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tr. 1, 11, 14</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45371.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the horses of the sun</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 183" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 183</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
steropes: <entryFree id="n45372" type="main" key="Ste^ro^pes"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stĕrŏpes</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*stero/phs</foreign>, <sense id="n45372.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of the Cyclops in Vulcan's smithy</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:8:425" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 8, 425</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:288" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 288</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> III. Cons. Hon. 195</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Rapt. Pros. 1, 239</bibl>; <case>acc.</case> Steropem, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:1:1:4" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 1, 1, 4</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sterquilinium: <entryFree id="n45373" type="main" key="sterqui^li_ni^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sterquĭlīnĭum</orth> (in MSS. also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">stercŭl-</orth> and <orth extent="full" lang="la">stercĭl-</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:19:1:17:section=2" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 19, 1, 17, § 2</bibl>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">sterquĭlīnum</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0975,001:3:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Phaedr.</author> 3, 12, 1</bibl>) [stercus], <sense id="n45373.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dung-pit</hi>, <hi rend="ital">laystall</hi>,<cb n="STIG" />  <hi rend="ital">mixen</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Cato</author>, R. R. 2, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:13:4" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> 1, 13, 4</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:1:38:3" default="NO">1, 38, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:6:21" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 6, 21</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:5:8" default="NO">7, 5, 8</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">Phaedr. l. l. —As a term of reproach,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:3:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Pers. 3, 3, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:1:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 1, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:3:2:41" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 3, 2, 41</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stertinius: <entryFree id="n45374" type="main" key="Sterti^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stertĭnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45374.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Stoic philosopher</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 33</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 3, 296</bibl>.—<hi rend="ital">Adj.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stertĭ-nĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of Stertinius</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">acumen,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 1, 12, 20</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sterto: <entryFree id="n45375" type="main" key="sterto"><orth extent="full" lang="la">sterto</orth>, <itype>ŭi</itype> (acc. to <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 903</bibl> P.; cf. desterto), <itype>3</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>cf.: <foreign lang="greek">de/rqw, darqa/nw</foreign></etym>, <sense id="n45375.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to snore</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">noctem totam stertere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,002:5:2:22" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> As. 5, 2, 22</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:3:2:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 3, 2, 7</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stertit noctes et dies,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,003:5:8:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Eun. 5, 8, 49</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 2, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Marcellus ita stertebat, ut ego vicinus audirem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> 4, 3, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 29, 93</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">diem totum stertebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui vigilans stertis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1048" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1048</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:3:3" default="NO"><author>Pers.</author> 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0969,001:5:132" default="NO">5, 132</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">vigilanti stertere naso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:1:57" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 1, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">altiore stertitur somno,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 27, 12, 8</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45375.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui stertit aestate,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,029:10:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Prov. 10, 5</bibl></cit>.—<pos>P. a.</pos> as <hi rend="ital">subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stertens</orth>, <itype>entis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">a snorer</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">prodi stertentium sonitu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 9, 10, 12, § 36</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stesichorus: <entryFree id="n45376" type="main" key="Ste_si^cho^rus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stēsĭchŏrus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sthsi/xoros</foreign>, <sense id="n45376.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Greek lyric poet of Himera</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Stesichori graves Camenae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:4:9:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 4, 9, 8</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:62" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 1, 62</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:7:23" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 7, 23</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:35:section=87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 35, § 87</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:5:3:154" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 5, 3, 154</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stheneboea: <entryFree id="n45377" type="main" key="Sthe^ne^boea"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sthĕnĕboea</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sthĕnŏboea</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sqene/boia, *sqeno/boia</foreign>, <sense id="n45377.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">daughter of Iobates</hi>, <hi rend="ital">king of Lycia</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:327" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 327</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 57" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 57</bibl> and 243.—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sthĕnĕ-boeïus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Sthenebœa</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">heros,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Bellerophon</tr>, <tr>whom Sthenebœa loved</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Carm. 11, 74</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sthenelus: <entryFree id="n45378" type="main" key="Sthe^ne^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sthĕnĕlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sqe/nelos</foreign>. <sense id="n45378.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">King of Mycenœ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">son of Perseus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and father of Eurystheus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 244" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 244</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45378.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">King of the Ligurians</hi>, <hi rend="ital">father of Cycnus</hi>, <hi rend="ital">who was changed into a swan</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and who</hi>, <hi rend="ital">from his father</hi>, <hi rend="ital">is called</hi> proles Stheneleïa, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 367</bibl>; cf. sqq.—</sense><sense id="n45378.2" n="III" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of the Epigoni</hi>, <hi rend="ital">charioteer of Diomede at the siege of Troy</hi>, <hi rend="ital">and one of those shut up in the wooden horse</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:2:261" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 2, 261</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,001:1:15:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> C. 1, 15, 24</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">4, 9, 20</bibl>.— </sense><sense id="n45378.3" n="IV" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A Rutulian</hi>, <hi rend="ital">slain by Pallas</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:388" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 388</bibl>.—Hence. </sense><sense id="n45378.4" n="A" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sthĕnĕlēĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">Stheneleian.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45378.5" n="(a)" level="5"> (Acc. to I.) Eurystheus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:9:273" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 9, 273</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">hostis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Eurystheus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,002:9:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 9, 25</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45378.6" n="(b)" level="5"> (Acc. to II.) Proles, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Cycnus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:367" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 367</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45378.7" n="B" level="2"> <orth extent="full" lang="la">Sthĕnĕlēis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Stheneleian</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">volucris,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>Cycnus</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:12:581" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 12, 581</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
sthenius: <entryFree id="n45379" type="main" key="Sthe^ni^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sthĕnĭus</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45379.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a Thermitan</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:34:section=83" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 34, § 83</bibl> sqq.</sense></entryFree>
sthennis: <entryFree id="n45380" type="main" key="Sthennis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sthennis</orth>, <itype>ĭdis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sqe/nis</foreign>, <sense id="n45380.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a sculptor of Olynthus</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:34:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 34, 8, 19, § 90</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stheno: <entryFree id="n45381" type="main" key="Sthe^no"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Sthĕno</orth>, <itype>ūs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sqenw/</foreign>, <sense id="n45381.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a daughter of Phorcus and Ceto</hi>, <hi rend="ital">sister of Medusa</hi>, Hyg. Fab. praef.</sense></entryFree>
stibadium: <entryFree id="n45382" type="greek" key="sti^ba^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭbădĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stiba/dion</foreign>, <sense id="n45382.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a semicircular seat</hi> or <hi rend="ital">couch</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:5:6:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 5, 6, 36</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 1, 698</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 1, 11 <hi rend="ital">med.</hi></bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 2</bibl> <hi rend="ital">med.</hi>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:14:87" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 14, 87</bibl> <hi rend="ital">in lemm.;</hi> <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 2358</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stibinus: <entryFree id="n45383" type="main" key="sti^bi^nus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭbĭnus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stibium</etym>, <sense id="n45383.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">antimonial</hi>, <hi rend="ital">of antimony</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">lapides,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,015:29:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 1 Par. 29, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stibium: <entryFree id="n45384" type="greek" key="sti^bi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭbĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen>; also called <orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭbi</orth>, <itype>is</itype>, and <orth extent="full" lang="la">stimmi</orth> = <foreign lang="greek">sti/bi, stimmi</foreign>, <sense id="n45384.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">antimony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a sulphuret of antimony</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stibium</hi>, used by women, in the form of powder, to color their eyebrows and eyelashes black; <cit><quote lang="la">and in medicine, as an eye-salve,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 6, 33, § 101</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:115" default="NO" valid="yes">29, 6, 37, § 115</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cels.</author> 6, 6, 6</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:8" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0836,001:6:6:12" default="NO" valid="yes">6, 6, 12</bibl> sq.; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:Comp. 27" default="NO"><author>Scrib.</author> Comp. 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1011,001:34 al" default="NO">34 al.</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,014:9:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> 4 Reg. 9, 30</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sticha: <entryFree id="n45385" type="hapax" key="sti^cha"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭcha</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">sti/xh</foreign>, <sense id="n45385.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of vine</hi> (pure Lat. apiana), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:14:81" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 14, 9, 11, § 81</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stichus: <entryFree id="n45386" type="main" key="Sti^chus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stĭchus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45386.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the name of a slave</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:193" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 193</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:2:199" default="NO">2, 199</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:4:55" default="NO">4, 55</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:14:27:section=7 al" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 2, 14, 27, § 7 al.</bibl>—Hence, </sense><sense id="n45386.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Title of a comedy of Plautus.</hi></sense></entryFree>
sticte: <entryFree id="n45387" type="main" key="Sticte_"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stictē</orth>, <itype>ēs</itype>, <gen>f.</gen>, <sense id="n45387.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">one of Actœon's hounds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:217" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 217</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 181" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 181</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
sticula: <entryFree id="n45388" type="hapax" key="sti^cu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭcŭla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <lbl>dim.</lbl>, <sense id="n45388.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a kind of grape</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:2:27" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 2, 27</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stigma: <entryFree id="n45389" type="greek" key="stigma"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stigma</orth>, <itype>ătis</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> (<sense id="n45389.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">fem.</hi> collat. form, <case>acc.</case> stigmam, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 45, 9</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">69, 1</bibl>), = <foreign lang="greek">sti/gma</foreign>, a prick, puncture (post-Aug.). </sense><sense id="n45389.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A mark burned in</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a brand</hi> impressed upon slaves or others, as a mark of disgrace. </sense><sense id="n45389.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 103, 2</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">105, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">inscribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:37:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 37, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stigmata fugitivo scribere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:7:4:14" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 7, 4, 14</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:27" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 4, 10, § 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stigmate dignus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:10:183" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 10, 183</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:56:6 al" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 56, 6 al.</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">or as a mark of ownership,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0031,009:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Gal. 6, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45389.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a mark of disgrace</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a</hi> <pb n="1759" /> <cb n="STIL" /> <hi rend="ital">stigma</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=jul.:73" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Caes. 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:6:64:26" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 6, 64, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:61:11" default="NO">12, 61, 11</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45389.4" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A cut</hi> on the face, made by an unskilful barber, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:11:84:13" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 11, 84, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stigmatias: <entryFree id="n45390" type="greek" key="stigma^ti^as"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stigmătĭas</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">stigmati/as</foreign>. <sense id="n45390.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One who is branded</hi>, of a slave, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 7, 25</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45390.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Title of a comedy of Nœvius</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=107" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 107</bibl> Müll.; v. Com. Rel. p. 19 Rib.</sense></entryFree>
stigmo: <entryFree id="n45391" type="main" key="stigmo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stigmo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>stigma</etym>, <sense id="n45391.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to brand</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stigmatize</hi> (late Lat.), Prud. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>. 10, 1079.</sense></entryFree>
stigmosus: <entryFree id="n45392" type="main" key="stigmo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stigmōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45392.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of brand-marks</hi>, <hi rend="ital">branded</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 109, 8</bibl>; Regul. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:5:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 5, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stilbon: <entryFree id="n45393" type="main" key="Stilbon"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stilbon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sti/lbwn</foreign> (the shining, glittering), <sense id="n45393.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a name of the planet Mercury</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Aus.</author> Idyll. 18, 11</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mart. Cap.</author> 8, § 851</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Astr. 2:42" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Astr. 2, 42 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl> (as Greek, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,050:2:20:53" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> N. D. 2, 20, 53</bibl>).—</sense><sense id="n45393.1" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">One of Actœon's hounds</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0533,001:Fab. 181" default="NO"><author>Hyg.</author> Fab. 181</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stilicho: <entryFree id="n45394" type="main" key="Stilicho"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stilicho</orth> (written STELICHO, <bibl default="NO"><author>Inscr. Orell.</author> 4999</bibl>), <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45394.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the famous general and father-in-law of the emperor Honorius</hi>, celebrated by Claudian in his poem De laudibus Stilichonis; cf. also <bibl default="NO"><author>Oros.</author> 7, 37 sq.</bibl>—Hence, <pos>adj.</pos>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stĭlĭchōnĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to Stilicho</hi>: virgo, i. e. <hi rend="ital">Maria</hi>, <hi rend="ital">daughter of Stilicho and wife of Honorius</hi>, Claud. Nupt. Hon. et Mar. 177.</sense></entryFree>
stilla: <entryFree id="n45395" type="main" key="stilla"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stilla</orth>, <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym><lbl>dim.</lbl> of stĭria; cf. Fest. s. v. stiricipium, p. 345 Müll.; Corss. 1, p. 518</etym>, <sense id="n45395.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a drop</hi> (a dense, viscous, gummy, fatty drop; <cit><quote lang="la">whereas gutta is a natural, liquid drop: gutta imbrium est, stilla olei vel aceti,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Fragm. p. 319, 27</bibl></cit> Roth). </sense><sense id="n45395.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (rare but class.): stilla muriae, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,048:3:14:45" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fin. 3, 14, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:29:70" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 29, 4, 21, § 70</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">sicca et sine stillis arbor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:9:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 9, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Serv.</author> Verg. A. 3, 366</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">olei,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 5, p. 169</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stilla saeva (arborum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:92" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 17, 12, 19, § 92</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45395.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a drop</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a small quantity</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">olei,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:12:70:3" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 12, 70, 3</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">pauculae temporum,</quote> <trans><tr>a very little</tr>, <tr>a moment</tr></trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2468,001:Ep. 140" default="NO"><author>Aug.</author> Ep. 140</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45395.3" n="III" level="1"> In later Lat. = gutta, stillae pluviae, <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 36, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">roris,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 38, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">pluviarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:3:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Jer. 3, 3</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stillanter: <entryFree id="n45396" type="main" key="stillanter"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stillanter</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>stillo</etym>, <sense id="n45396.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">drop by drop</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Ambros.</author> Ep. 41, 14</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stillarium: <entryFree id="n45397" type="main" key="stilla_ri^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stillārĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>stilla</etym>, <sense id="n45397.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an added drop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a trifling addition</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 97:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 97, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stillaticius: <entryFree id="n45398" type="hapax" key="stilla_ti_ci^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stillātīcĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stillo</etym>, <sense id="n45398.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dropping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dripping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stillatitious</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">resina,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:16:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 16, 11, 22, § 54</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stillatim: <entryFree id="n45399" type="hapax" key="stilla_tim"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stillātim</orth>, <pos>adv.</pos> <etym>stilla</etym>, <sense id="n45399.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">by drops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drop by drop</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stillatim cadere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=27" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 27</bibl></cit> Müll.</sense></entryFree>
stillatio: <entryFree id="n45400" type="main" key="stilla_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stillātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>stillo</etym>, <sense id="n45400.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a dropping down</hi>, <hi rend="ital">falling in drops</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">pluviae,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hier.</author> in Mich. 1, 2, 6</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stillativus: <entryFree id="n45401" type="main" key="stilla_ti_vus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stillātīvus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45401.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">dropping</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dripping</hi> (late Lat.): <cit><quote lang="la">mel,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Plin. Val.</author> 1, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stillicidium: <entryFree id="n45402" type="main" key="stilli^ci^di^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stillĭcĭdĭum</orth> (also written <orth extent="full" lang="la">stilĭcĭd-</orth>; v. Lachm. ad <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:page=33" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> p. 33</bibl>), <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>stilla-cado</etym>, <sense id="n45402.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a liquid which falls drop by drop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a dripping moisture</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stillicide</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stillicidium eo quod stillatim cadat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=27" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 27</bibl></cit> Müll. </sense><sense id="n45402.1" n="I" level="1"> In gen. (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">stillicidi casus lapidem cavat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:313" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 313</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">grandinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 4:3:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q.
