N. 4, 3, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">urinae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:30:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 30, 8, 21, § 66</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">vesicae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:28:122" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 28, 8, 32, § 122</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">arborum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:17:89" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 17, 12, 18, § 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">mellis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Spect. 27 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: raritas nubium stillicidia dispergit, App. de Mundo, p. 61.—</sense><sense id="n45402.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">per stillicidia emittere animam quam semel exhalare,</quote> <trans><tr>little by little</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 101:14" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 101, 14</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45402.3" n="II" level="1"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">falling rain</hi>, <hi rend="ital">rain-water falling from the eaves of houses</hi> (class.): <cit><quote lang="la">jura parietum, luminum, stillicidiorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:38:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 38, 173</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:21:79" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Or. 21, 79</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,042:5:27" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Top. 5, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1056,001:2:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vitr.</author> 2, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:6:8" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 8, 6, 8</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:8:2:20" default="NO">8, 2, 20</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Aug. 8, 2</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stillo: <entryFree id="n45403" type="main" key="stillo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stillo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> and <sense id="n45403.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a</hi> [stilla]. </sense><sense id="n45403.1" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Neutr.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">drip</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trickle</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distil</hi> (mostly <usg type="style">poet.</usg>; syn. roro). </sense><sense id="n45403.2" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">vas, unde stillet lente aqua,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:R. R. 1:41:2" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> R. R. 1, 41, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">gutta (dulcedinis) in cor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1060" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1060</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">umorem, quasi igni cera super calido tabescens multa liquescat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:515" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 515</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">cruor ferro,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:2:8:26" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 2, 8, 26</bibl></cit> (2, 8 b, 26 (10)): <cit><quote lang="la">unguenta capillo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:7:51" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 7, 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de viridi ilice mella,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ros,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:11:57" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 11, 57</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hammoniaci lacrima stillat m harenis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:12:107" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 12, 23, 49, § 107</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45403.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, of things which <hi rend="ital">drop</hi> or <hi rend="ital">drop with</hi> a liquid: <cit><quote lang="la">saxa guttis manantibu' stillent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:6:943" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 6, 943</bibl></cit>' paenula multo nimbo, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:5:79" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 5, 79</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coma Syrio rore,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:3:4:28" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 3, 4, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">sanguine sidera,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,001:1:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> Am. 1, 8, 11</bibl></cit>; cf.<cit><quote lang="la">' arbor sanguineis roribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:837" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 837</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Thyest 1061" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Thyest 1061</bibl>—Without <case>abl.</case>: umida saxa, <cb n="STIL" /> super viridi stillantia musco, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:5:951" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 5, 951</bibl>: ille, qui stillantem prae se pugionem tulit, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:12:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 12, 30</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">uva,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:10:56:5" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 10, 56, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Vulg.</author> Job, 16, 21</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45403.4" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">stillantes voces,</quote> <trans><tr>words that ooze out drop by drop</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0830,001:6:23" default="NO"><author>Calp.</author> Ecl. 6, 23</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">orationem stillare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 40:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 40, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plumis stillare diem,</quote> <trans><tr>to be full</tr>, <tr>to abound in</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:3:537" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 3, 537</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45403.5" n="II" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Act.</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to cause to drop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">let fall in drops</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to drop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">distil</hi>: stillabit amicis Ex oculis rorem, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,006:429" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> A. P. 429</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">coctam caepam cum adipe anserino,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 20, 5, 20, § 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stillata De ramis electra,</quote> <trans><tr>dropped</tr>, <tr>distilled</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:364" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 364</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stillata cortice myrrha,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,010:10:501" default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 10, 501</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">acre malum stillans ocellus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:6:109" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 6, 109</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45403.6" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to drop</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instil</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum facilem stillavit in aurem Exiguum de veneno,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:3:123" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 3, 123</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stilo: <entryFree id="n45404" type="hapax" key="sti^lo1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, 1</itype>, <pos>v. n.</pos> <etym>stilus, I.</etym>, <sense id="n45404.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to get stalks</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:4:33:3" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 4, 33, 3</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45405" type="main" key="Sti^lo2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stĭlo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <sense id="n45405.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a surname of</hi> L. Aelius Praeconinus, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 1, 7, § 29</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,004:3" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Gram. 3</bibl>; cf. v. Hensde, Disquis. de L. Aelio Stilone; and Ritschl, Parerga, p. 239.</sense></entryFree>
stilpo: <entryFree id="n45406" type="main" key="Stilpo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stilpo</orth> or <orth extent="full" lang="la">Stilpon</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, = <foreign lang="greek">*sti/lpwn</foreign>. <sense id="n45406.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A proper name</hi>, Ter. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:47:157" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 47, 157</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45406.1" n="II" level="1"> Esp., <hi rend="ital">a philosopher of Megara</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,054:5:10" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Fat. 5, 10</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Ac. 2, 24, 75</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 9:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 9, 1</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stilus: <entryFree id="n45407" type="greek" key="sti^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭlus</orth> (not <orth extent="full" lang="la">stylus</orth>), <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>for stiglus; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sti/zw</foreign>, to stick, puncture; <foreign lang="greek">sti/gma</foreign>, mark, point; Sanscr. tig, to be sharp; tigmas, sharp; cf. Engl. stick, sting; Lat. stimulus; not connected with <foreign lang="greek">stu=los</foreign></etym>. <sense id="n45407.0" n="I" level="1"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">a stake</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pale</hi>: extra vallum stili caeci, <hi rend="ital">concealed stakes</hi>, Auct. B. Afr. 31, 5; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:10:415" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 10, 415</bibl> (for which stimuli, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">ligneus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 23, 4, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">15, 10, 5</bibl>.—In agriculture, <hi rend="ital">a pointed instrument for freeing plants from worms or from shoots which grow too rankly</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:53" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 53</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Pall.</author> Mart. 10, 20</bibl>.—Of <hi rend="ital">the stem</hi> or <hi rend="ital">stalk</hi> of many plants (e. g. of the asparagus), <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:46" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 11, 3, 46</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:11:3:58" default="NO">11, 3, 58</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:5:10:13" default="NO">5, 10, 13</bibl>; 5, 10, 21.—</sense><sense id="n45407.1" n="II" level="1"> In partic. </sense><sense id="n45407.2" n="A" level="2"> <hi rend="ital">A style</hi> used by the Romans for writing on waxen tablets (pointed, and usually made of iron): <cit><quote lang="la">effer cito stilum, ceram et tabellas et linum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,004:4:4:64" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Bacch. 4, 4, 64</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 4, 4, 76</bibl>; 4, 9, 73; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 27</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cum otiosus stilum prehenderat, flaccebat oratio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:24:93" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 24, 93</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">orationes paene Attico stilo scriptae,</quote> <trans><tr>with an Attic pen</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 45, 167</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">(comoediae quaedam) resipiant stilum Plautinum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1254,001:3:3:13" default="NO"><author>Gell.</author> 3, 3, 13</bibl></cit>.—And with reference to the ecenomical use, in a double sense, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:23:96" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 2, 23, 96</bibl>.—Writing on wax was erased with the broad upper end of the style; hence the phrase stilum vertere, for <hi rend="ital">to erase what one has written</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:2:41:section=101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 2, 41, § 101</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">saepe stilum vertas, iterum quae digna legi sint, Scripturus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:10:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 10, 73</bibl></cit>.—But cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">et mihi vertenti stilum in Gallias,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>turning to write of</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 29, 3, 1</bibl></cit>.—Comically: <cit><quote lang="la">stilis me totum usque ulmeis conscribito,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>with elm switches</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:5:131" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 5, 131</bibl></cit> (cf. conscribo).—</sense><sense id="n45407.3" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45407.4" n="1" level="3"> = scriptio and scriptura, <hi rend="ital">a setting down in writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">composing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">composition; the practice of composing; manner of writing</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mode of composition</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">stilus optimus et praestantissimus dicendi effector ac magister,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:1:33:150" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> de Or. 1, 33, 150</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">1, 60, 257</bibl>; cf. <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 49, 190</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:9:2" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 9, 2</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">multus stilus et assidua lectio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:4" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stilus exercitatus,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>a practised pen</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,040:44:150" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Or. 44, 150</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardior stilus cogitationem moratur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:28" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">neglegens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:2:4:13" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 2, 4, 13</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:1:1" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 1, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tardus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:3:5" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 3, 5</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rudis et confusus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:1:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 1, 1, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fidelis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:7" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 10, 7, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stilo incumbere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:7:29:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 7, 29, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquid stilo prosequi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 1:8:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 8, 8</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">2, 3, 3: signare stilo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1044,001:1:16:1" default="NO"><author>Vell.</author> 1, 16, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non ita dissimili sunt argumento, sed tamen Dissimili oratione sunt factae ac stilo,</quote> <trans><tr>in speech and writing</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,001:prol. 12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> And. prol. 12</bibl></cit> (for which: <cit><quote lang="la">oratione et scripturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:prol. 5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phorm. prol. 5</bibl></cit>); cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">unus sonus est totius orationis et idem stilus,</quote> <trans><tr>the same tone and the same style of composition run through the whole speech</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,039:26:100" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Brut. 26, 100</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">artifex stilus,</quote> <trans><tr>an artistic style</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 25, 96</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">familiares opes velut supremo distribuens stilo,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>by his last will</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 25, 3, 21</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45407.5" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A manner of speaking</hi>, <hi rend="ital">mode of expression</hi>, <hi rend="ital">style</hi> in speaking (post-Aug. and very rare; not as early as Quint.; <cit><quote lang="la">in class. Lat. sermo, oratio, dictio, dicendi modus, ars, genus or forma): stilus pressus demissusque,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:1:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 1, 8</bibl></cit>, <cb n="STIM" /> 5: <cit><quote lang="la">pugnax et quasi bellatorins,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 7:9:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 9, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">laetior,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:ib. 3:18:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 18, 10</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">diligentis stili anxietas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Octavius) tragoediam magno impetu exorsus, non succedente stilo, abolevit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:85" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 85</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">affectatione obscurabat stilum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=tib.:70" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Tib. 70</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stili dicendi duo sunt: unus est maturus et gravis, alter ardens erectus et infensus, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Macr.</author> S. 5, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">6, 3</bibl>.—* </sense><sense id="n45407.6" n="3" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A decision</hi>, <hi rend="ital">verdict</hi>, <hi rend="ital">opinion</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 10, p. 242, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stimmi: <entryFree id="n45408" type="main" key="stimmi"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stimmi</orth>, v. stibium.</entryFree>
stimula: <entryFree id="n45409" type="main" key="Sti^mu^la"><orth extent="full" lang="la">Stĭmŭla</orth> (<orth extent="full" lang="la">Sĭmĭla</orth>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 39, 12</bibl>), <itype>ae</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>stimulus</etym>, <sense id="n45409.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">the goddess who pricks on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">excites</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stimulates</hi> to action or pleasure, Aug. Civ Del, 4, 11; 4, 16; <cit><quote lang="la">perh. for Semele,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:6:503" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 6, 503</bibl></cit>; Schol. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1276,001:2:3" default="NO"><author>Juv.</author> 2, 3</bibl>; cf. Müller, Etrusk. 2, 77.</sense></entryFree>
stimulatio: <entryFree id="n45410" type="main" key="sti^mu^la_ti^o"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭmŭlātĭo</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>stimulo</etym>, <sense id="n45410.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pricking on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incitement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stimulation</hi> (post-Aug.): <cit><quote lang="la">ingens,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:35:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 35, 2, 2, § 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">privata cuique,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:1:90" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 1, 90 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit></sense></entryFree>
stimulator: <entryFree id="n45411" type="main" key="sti^mu^la_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭmŭlātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45411.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a pricker-on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instigator</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stimulator</hi>, Claud. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Ruf.</author> 2, 501</bibl>; <bibl default="NO"><author>Mamert.</author> Grat. Act. ad Iul. 5</bibl> (in <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,020:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Dom. 5, 11</bibl>, Orell. and B. and K. read instimulator); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,049:46:20" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Jer. 46, 20</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stimulatrix: <entryFree id="n45412" type="main" key="sti^mu^la_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭmŭlātrix</orth>, <itype>īcis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>stimulator</etym>, <sense id="n45412.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">she that pricks on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">instigates</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">stimulates</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,013:1:3:46" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Most. 1, 3, 46</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">1, 3, 62</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stimuleus: <entryFree id="n45413" type="hapax" key="sti^mu^le^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭmŭlĕus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stimulus</etym>, <sense id="n45413.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">consisting of prickles</hi> or <hi rend="ital">goads</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">supplicium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,012:2:6:31" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Mil. 2, 6, 31</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stimulo: <entryFree id="n45414" type="main" key="sti^mu^lo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭmŭlo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45414.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to prick with a goad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to prick</hi> or <hi rend="ital">goad on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to urge on</hi> (syn. pungo). </sense><sense id="n45414.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg> (post-Aug. and rare): <cit><quote lang="la">quadrijugos flagello,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:4:439" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 4, 439</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">equos calcaribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:3:2:9" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 3, 2, 9</bibl></cit>; for which, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> transf.: <cit><quote lang="la">turbatos currus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:7:570" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 7, 570</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:16:367" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 16, 367</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">aries stimulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:7:3:5" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 7, 3, 5</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45414.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to goad</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">vex</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trouble</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disquiet</hi>, <hi rend="ital">disturb</hi> (class. and freq.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn. agito): jactor, crucior, agitor, stimulor, vorsor in amoris rota miser,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,007:2:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Cist. 2, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hunc sibi ex animo scrupulum, qui se dies noctesque stimulat ac pungit, ut evellatis, postulat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,002:2:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Rosc. Am. 2, 6</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">larvae stimulant virum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,005:3:4:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Capt. 3, 4, 66</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">te conscientiae stimulant maleficiorum tuorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,047:2:18" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Par. 2, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me nunc et congressus hujus (Caesaris) stimulat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:9:15:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 9, 15, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">me haec solitudo minus stimulat quam ista celebritas,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 12, 13, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">consulem cura de minore filio stimulabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:44:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 44, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stimulatus furenti rabie,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:63:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 63, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">curis animum stimulantibus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Ruf. 2, 326</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45414.3" n="B" level="2"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">to rouse up</hi>, <hi rend="ital">set in motion; to spur on</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stimulate</hi> to any action (syn. cieo, excio). </sense><sense id="n45414.4" n="(a)" level="5"> With simple <hi rend="ital">acc.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">Phrygio stimulat numero cava tibia mentes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:620" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 620</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:68:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 68, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">avita gloria animum stimulabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:22:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 22, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">irā stimulante animos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:12:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 12, 1</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:11" default="NO" valid="yes">30, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">cupido animum stimulabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:7:8" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 7, 8</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:6:5:19" default="NO">6, 5, 19</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stimulata pellicis irā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:4:235" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 4, 235</bibl></cit>.—With inanim. objects: <cit><quote lang="la">jurgia praecipue vino stimulata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,004:1:591" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> A. A. 1, 591</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Persicorum sucus sitim stimulat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:23:132" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 23, 7, 67, § 132</bibl></cit>; so, <cit><quote lang="la">venerem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:20:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 20, 5, 15, § 32</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">conceptus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:2:38" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 8, 6, § 38</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fugam hostium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:9:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 9, 8, 9, § 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">iras functas,</quote> <trans><tr>to revive</tr>, <tr>arouse</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:12:437" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 12, 437</bibl></cit>. —</sense><sense id="n45414.5" n="(b)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ad</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad alicujus salutem defendendam stimulari atque excitari,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,028:28:69" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Planc. 28, 69</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad perturbandam rempublicam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 18:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 18, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad arma,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:23:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 23, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad iram,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 44</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45414.6" n="(g)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">in</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">injuriae dolor in Tarquinium eos stimulabat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:40:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 40, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">animos eorum irā in hostes stimulando,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:11:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 11, 3</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">in a mixed construction: ad iram saepius quam in formidinem stimulabantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:2:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 2, 44 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>—</sense><sense id="n45414.7" n="(d)" level="5"> With <hi rend="ital">ut</hi> or <hi rend="ital">ne</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vetus nostra simultas antea stimulabat me, ut caverem, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:3:12:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 3, 12, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rubore stimulabantur, ne clientulorum loco numerarentur,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tac.</author> Or. 37</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:26" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 7, 7, 26</bibl>.—（<foreign lang="greek">e</foreign>) <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>, with <hi rend="ital">inf.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">festinare fugam ... iterum stimulat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:576" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 576</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stimulante metu fati praenoscere cursus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:6:423" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 6, 423</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juvencos jactare accensis stimulavi cornibus ignes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:12:504" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 12, 504</bibl></cit>.—（<foreign lang="greek">z</foreign>) <usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">stimulante fame,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,008:1:6:9" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> Tr. 1, 6, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stimulante conscientiā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:11:7" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 11, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">metu stimulante,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:7:7:26" default="NO"><author>id.</author> 7, 7, 26</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stimulosus: <entryFree id="n45415" type="main" key="sti^mu^lo_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭmŭlōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45415.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">full of incentives</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stimulative</hi> (post-class.): <cit><quote lang="la">desiderium Venereae voluptatis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Tard. 5:9" default="NO"><author>Cael. Aur.</author> Tard. 5, 9</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:Acut. 2:14" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Acut. 2, 14</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2305,001:3:18" default="NO">3, 18</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stimulus: <entryFree id="n45416" type="main" key="sti^mu^lus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭmŭlus</orth>, <itype>i</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>for stig-mulus, from the root stig; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sti/zw</foreign>; v. stilus</etym>. <sense id="n45416.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">A goad</hi> for driving cattle, slaves, etc. (class., <pb n="1760" /> <cb n="STIP" /> esp. in the trop. sense). </sense><sense id="n45416.1" n="A" level="2"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">jam lora teneo, jam stimulum in manu: Agite equi, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,010:5:2:112" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Men. 5, 2, 112</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parce, puer, stimulis, et fortius utere loris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:2:127" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 2, 127</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aut stimulo tardos increpuisse boves,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:30" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 30</bibl></cit> (12); cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:14:647" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 14, 647</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita te forabunt patibulatum per vias Stimulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,016:1:1:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ps. 1, 1, 54</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">aliquem stimulo fodere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,008:1:2:40" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Curc. 1, 2, 40</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum te stimulis fodiam,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:2:34:86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Phil. 2, 34, 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numquam stimulo lacessat juvencum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:2:2:26" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 2, 2, 26</bibl></cit>.—As a term of abuse of slaves: <cit><quote lang="la">stimulorum seges,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,003:1:1:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Aul. 1, 1, 6</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,006:2:8:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cas. 2, 8, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stimulorum tritor,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,014:5:2:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Pers. 5, 2, 17</bibl></cit>.—Prov.: <cit><quote lang="la">si stimulos pugnis caedis, manibus plus dolet,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>an evil is aggravated by foolish opposition</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:2:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 2, 55</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">advorsum stimulum calces,</quote> <trans><tr>kick against the pricks</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,004:1:2:28" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Phorm. 1, 2, 28</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45416.2" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a goad</hi> (as in Engl., either that which vexes, irritates, torments, or, more freq., that which spurs on, incites, stimulates). </sense><sense id="n45416.3" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A sting</hi>, <hi rend="ital">torment</hi>, <hi rend="ital">pang</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">mens sibi conscia factis ... adhibet stimulos torretque flagellis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:1019" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 3, 1019</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">subesse caecum aliquem cordi stimulum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:3:874" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 874</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ne illa stimulum longum habet, quae usque illinc cor pungit meum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,020:4:3:79" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Truc. 4, 3, 79</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stimulos doloris contemnere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,049:2:27:66" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Tusc. 2, 27, 66</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">(res malae) lacerant, vexant, stimulos admovent, etc.,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 16, 35</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stimulos in pectore caecos Condidit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:1:726" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 1, 726</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45416.4" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A spur</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incentive</hi>, <hi rend="ital">incitement</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stimulus</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">animum gloriae stimulis concitare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,016:11:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Arch. 11, 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quidam industriae ac laboris (with illecebrae libidinum),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quot stimulos admoverit homini victoriae studioso,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 5, 12</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">defendendi Vatinii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:1:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Fam. 1, 9, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">omnia pro stimulis facibusque ciboque furoris Accipit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:6:480" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 6, 480</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardet, et injusti stimulis agitatur amoris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:779" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 779</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">non hostili modo odio sed amoris etiam stimulis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:30:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 30, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad hanc voluntatem ipsius naturae stimulis incitamur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,043:1:2:3" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Rep. 1, 2, 3</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad dicendum etiam pudor stimulos habet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:10:7:16" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 10, 7, 16</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">agrariae legis tribuniciis stimulis plebs furebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:54" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 54</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">acriores quippe aeris alieni stimulos esse,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 11</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">subdere stimulos animo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:6:34" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 6, 34</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">in aliquem stimulis accendi,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,004:3:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> H. 3, 45</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">suis stimulis excitos Moesiae duces,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 53</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">secundae res acrioribus stimulis animos explorant,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 15</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">acres Subjectat lasso stimulos,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:7:94" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 7, 94</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stimulos sub pectore vertit Apollo,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:6:101" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 6, 101</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">movere acres stimulos irarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:2:324" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 2, 324</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">accensae stimulis majoribus irae,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,001:11:497" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> Th. 11, 497</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dare stimulos laudum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> Achill. 1, 203</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45416.5" n="II" level="1"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">a pointed stake</hi> concealed beneath the surface of the ground, to repel hostile troops (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">sudes, stipes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">se stimulis induere,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 7, 82</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stinguo: <entryFree id="n45417" type="main" key="stinguo"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stinguo</orth>, <itype>ĕre</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym>cf. stig; Gr. <foreign lang="greek">sti/zw</foreign>; cf. also Germ. ersticken</etym>, <sense id="n45417.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to quench</hi>, <hi rend="ital">extinguish</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and very rare, for the usu. extinguo): <cit><quote lang="la">ut cernere possis Evanescere paulatim stinguique colorem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:828" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 2, 828</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ignes stingui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:666" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 666</bibl></cit>; so, stinguuntur radii (solis), Cic. poët. Fragm. ap. <bibl default="NO"><author>Prisc.</author> p. 882</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stinguens praeclara insignia caeli,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib.</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ardorem membris,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:4:1098" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 4, 1098</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stipa: <entryFree id="n45418" type="main" key="stipa"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stipa</orth>, v. stuppa.</entryFree>
stipatio: <entryFree id="n45419" type="main" key="sti_pa_tio"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stīpātio</orth>, <itype>ōnis</itype>, <gen>f.</gen> <etym>stipo</etym>, <sense id="n45419.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a crowd</hi> pressing around any one, <hi rend="ital">a suite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retinue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">train.</hi> </sense><sense id="n45419.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">latrones dicti ab latere, qui circum latera erant regi, quos postea a stipatione stipatores appellarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=52" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 52</bibl></cit> Müll. <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>: concursatio, stipatio, greges hominum perditorum, * <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,015:23:66" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Sull. 23, 66</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Q. N. 5:3:3" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Q. N. 5, 3, 3</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:4:16:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 4, 16, 1</bibl>; Auct. Pan. ad Maxim. et Const. 8 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi>—Of geese swarming together, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:53" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 22, 27, § 53</bibl>.— * </sense><sense id="n45419.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a crowd</hi>, <hi rend="ital">throng</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">aggressionum et enthymematum stipatio,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:5:14:27" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 5, 14, 27</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stipator: <entryFree id="n45420" type="main" key="sti_pa_tor"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stīpātor</orth>, <itype>ōris</itype>, <gen>m.</gen> <etym>stipo; prop. one that presses upon, crowds about another; hence</etym>, <sense id="n45420.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">an attendant</hi> of a nobleman; in <number>plur.</number>, <hi rend="ital">attendants</hi>, <hi rend="ital">train</hi>, <hi rend="ital">suite</hi>, <hi rend="ital">retinue</hi>, <hi rend="ital">bodyguard</hi>, etc. (class.; used by the Romans in a bad sense; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">satelles): latrones dicti ab latere, qui circum latera erant regi, quos postea a stipatione stipatores appellarunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 7:section=52" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 7, § 52</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">Alexander Pheraeus praemittebat de stipatoribus suis, qui scrutarentur arculas muliebres,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,055:2:7:25" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Off. 2, 7, 25</bibl></cit>; <cit><quote lang="la">of a royal train,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:1:3:138" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 1, 3, 138</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Clem. 1:13:1" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Clem. 1, 13, 1</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:4:25" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 4, 25</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">11</bibl>, <cb n="STIP" /> 16; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:13:4 al" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 13, 4 al.</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipatores corporis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,011:2:13:32" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Agr. 2, 13, 32</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">Venerii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:26:section=65" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 26, § 65</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">Catilina omnium flagitiorum atque facinorum circum se, tamquam stipatorum, catervas habebat,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 14, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stipatrix: <entryFree id="n45421" type="main" key="stipa_trix"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stipātrix</orth>, <itype>trīcis</itype>, <sense id="n45421.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">adj. f.</hi> [stipator], <hi rend="ital">attendant upon</hi>, <hi rend="ital">thronging in attendance</hi>: turmae stipatrices, Ambros. Hexaëm. 5, 16, 53.</sense></entryFree>
stipatus: <entryFree id="n45422" type="main" key="sti_pa_tus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stīpātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <mood>Part.</mood> and <pos>P. a.</pos> of stipo.</entryFree>
stipendialis: <entryFree id="n45423" type="hapax" key="sti_^pendi^a_lis"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stī^pendĭālis</orth>, <itype>e</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stipendium</etym>, <sense id="n45423.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to tribute</hi>: foedere stĭpendiali. <hi rend="ital">by which one engages to pay tribute</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 8, 9</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stipendiarius: <entryFree id="n45424" type="main" key="sti^_pendi^a_ri^us"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stĭ_pendĭārĭus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>. <sense id="n45424.0" n="I" level="1"> <hi rend="ital">Of</hi> or <hi rend="ital">belonging to tribute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">liable to impost</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contribution</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tributary</hi> (of imposts payable in money; whereas vectigalis denotes those payable in kind; the former was held to be the most humiliating; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:55" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 37, 55 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>): <cit><quote lang="la">civitas,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:30" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 30</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 39</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes">28, 25, 9</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Aedui,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">oppidum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:5:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 5, 4, 4, § 29</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">provincia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:2:17" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 2, 17</bibl></cit>: vectigal, i. e. <hi rend="ital">a fixed yearly impost</hi> or <hi rend="ital">contribution in money</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:3:6:section=12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 3, 6, § 12</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">praedia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1251,001:Inst. 2:21" default="NO"><author>Gai.</author> Inst. 2, 21</bibl></cit>.—<hi rend="ital">Plur. subst.</hi>: <orth extent="full" lang="la">stī^pen-dĭārĭi</orth>, <itype>ōrum</itype>, <gen>m.</gen>, <hi rend="ital">tributaries</hi> (in money; <cit><quote lang="la">whereas vectigales in kind): socii stipendiariique populi Romani,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,004:3:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Div. in Caecil. 3, 7</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:9:24" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Balb. 9, 24</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:3:18:41" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Leg. 3, 18, 41</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 10</bibl>; (opp. vectigales) <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:60:section=134" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 60, § 134</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,025:5:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Prov. Cons. 5, 10</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:24:47" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 24, 47</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:37:55" default="NO" valid="yes">37, 55</bibl> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">vectigalis stipendiariusque et servus populi Romani (Hannibal),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:41:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 21, 41, 7</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45424.1" n="II" level="1"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">receiving pay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">serving for pay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stipendiary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(Romani) postquam stipendiarii facti sunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:8:8:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 8, 8, 3</bibl></cit>: cohortes, Auct. B. Afr. 43.</sense></entryFree>
stipendior: <entryFree id="n45425" type="main" key="sti_pendi^or"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stīpendĭor</orth>, <itype>ātus, 1</itype>, <sense id="n45425.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">v. dep. n.</hi> [id.], <hi rend="ital">to receive pay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to serve for pay</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">regi eorum peditum sexcenta M. stipendiantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:6:68" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 6, 19, 22, § 68</bibl></cit>.—<usg type="style">Transf.</usg>: (infantes Pontici) butyro stipendiati, <hi rend="ital">serving for butter</hi>, <hi rend="ital">getting butter for pay</hi>, i. e. <hi rend="ital">for their maintenance</hi>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> adv. Marc. 3, 13</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stipendiosus: <entryFree id="n45426" type="hapax" key="sti_pendi^o_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stīpendĭōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>id.</etym>, <sense id="n45426.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">belonging to military service</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">milites (opp. tirones),</quote> <trans><tr>soldiers in the very service</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Veg.</author> 1, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stipendium: <entryFree id="n45427" type="main" key="sti_pendi^um"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stīpendĭum</orth>, <itype>ii</itype>, <gen>n.</gen> <etym>contr. from stipipendium, from stips-pendo</etym>. <sense id="n45427.0" n="I" level="1"> In publicists' lang., <hi rend="ital">a tax</hi>, <hi rend="ital">impost</hi>, <hi rend="ital">tribute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contribution</hi> (payable in money; whereas vectigal in kind; the former being regarded as the more humiliating; v. stipendiarius, I.): Poeni stipendia pendunt, Enn. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=182" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 182</bibl> Müll. (Ann. v. 269 Vahl.); so, <cit><quote lang="la">pendere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">5, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:C. 20:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> C. 20, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 9</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:10" default="NO" valid="yes">21, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">conferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:42" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 33, 42</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">solvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:39:7" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 39, 7</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">imponere victis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:1:44" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 1, 44</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">7, 54</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendio liberare aliquem,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> 5, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">de stipendio recusare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 44</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendi spem facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:28:25:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 28, 25, 9</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45427.1" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45427.2" n="1" level="3"> In gen., <hi rend="ital">tribute</hi>, <hi rend="ital">dues</hi> (<usg type="style">poet.</usg> and in post-Aug. prose): <cit><quote lang="la">indomito nec dira ferens stipendia tauro (sc. Minotauro),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:173" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 173</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quae finis aut quod me manet stipendium?</quote> <trans><tr>penalty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,003:17:36" default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Epod. 17, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">alii tamen obscuriores (scriptores) aliquod stipendium nostro studio contulerunt,</quote> <trans><tr>contribution</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:1:1:10" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 1, 1, 10</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45427.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">Income</hi>, <hi rend="ital">subsistence</hi>, <hi rend="ital">salary</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">iis, ut adsiduae templi antistites essent, stipendium de publico statuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:1:20:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 1, 20, 3</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45427.4" n="II" level="1"> In milit. lang., <hi rend="ital">pay</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stipend</hi> in full: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendium militare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:60:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 60, 5</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 45</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">commonly stipendium alone: militis stipendia ideo, quod eam stipem pendebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=182" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 182</bibl></cit> Müll.; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:33:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 33, 3, 13, § 43</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:59" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 59</bibl> and 60: <cit><quote lang="la">cum stipendium ab legionibus flagitaretur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:87" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 87</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerare militibus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:36:88" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 36, 88</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">persolvere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:5:14:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 5, 14, 1</bibl></cit>: dare, Brut. ap. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,056:11:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Fam. 11, 26</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:2:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 2, 12</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 12</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">dare pecuniam in stipendium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:23" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 1, 23</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 9 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">accipere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 5, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendio afficere exercitum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,026:27:61" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Balb. 27, 61</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">augere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:3:110" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. C. 3, 110</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fraudare,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 59</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendium duum mensium,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:5:1:45" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 5, 1, 45</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">dum in calamitosis stipendiis versaretur,</quote> <trans><tr>might get pay by the misfortunes of others</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Amm.</author> 19, 12, 2</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45427.5" n="B" level="2"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">military service</hi> (mostly in <number>plur.</number>): <cit><quote lang="la">merere stipendia,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:5:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 5, 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendia merere (mereri),</quote> <trans><tr>to perform military service</tr>, <tr>to serve</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,024:5:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Cael. 5, 11</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,037:2:64:258" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> de Or. 2, 64, 258</bibl>; also, <cit><quote lang="la">facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 63:3" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 63, 3</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:7" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 7</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:34 al" default="NO" valid="yes">42, 34 al.</bibl>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">opulenta ac ditia facere,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:21:43" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 21, 43</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">emereri,</quote> <trans><tr>to complete the time of service</tr>, <tr>to serve out one's time</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 25, 6</bibl></cit>; Cic. <cb n="STIP" /> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:14:49" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> 14, 49</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 84:2" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 84, 2</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:57" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 3, 57</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:6:1:10" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 6, 1, 10</bibl>; <cit><quote lang="la">v. emereo, II.: auxiliaria stipendia mereri,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:2:52" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 2, 52</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">numerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:4:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 4, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">enumerare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:3:58" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 3, 58</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui (milites) jam stipendiis confecti erant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,009:9:26" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Imp. Pomp. 9, 26</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendiis exhausti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:9" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 27, 9</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">adulescentuli statim castrensibus stipendiis imbuebantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:8:14:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 8, 14, 5</bibl></cit>.— <hi rend="ital">Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">homo nullius stipendii,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:J. 85:10" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Sall.</author> J. 85, 10</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">exercitui dare,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0631,001:H. 2:96:6" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> H. 2, 96, 6</bibl></cit> Dietsch: <cit><quote lang="la">sextus decimus stipendii annus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 17</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45427.6" n="2" level="3"> In partic., <hi rend="ital">military service of a year</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a year's service</hi>, <hi rend="ital">a campaign</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">si in singulis stipendiis is ad hostes exuvias dabit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0119,009:1:1:36" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plaut.</author> Ep. 1, 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">quod tricena aut quadragena stipendia senes tolerent,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1351,005:1:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Tac.</author> A. 1, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">vicena stipendia meritis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 1, 36</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendia sua numerari jubebant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:12:11:4" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 12, 11, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui eorum minime multa stipendia haberet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:31:8" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 31, 8</bibl></cit> <hi rend="ital">fin.—Sing.</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">(juventus) octavo jam stipendio functa,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0530,001:B. G. 8:8:2" default="NO"><author>Hirt.</author> B. G. 8, 8, 2</bibl></cit>; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">with both numbers together: secundo stipendio dextram manum perdidit, stipendiis duobus ter et vicies vulneratus est,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:7:28:29" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 7, 28, 29</bibl></cit> § 104.—</sense><sense id="n45427.7" n="C" level="2"> <usg type="style">Trop.</usg>, in gen., <hi rend="ital">service</hi> (very rare): <cit><quote lang="la">functus omnibus humanae vitae stipendiis,</quote> <trans>i. e. <tr>duties</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ep. 93:4" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ep. 93, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tamquam emeritis stipendiis libidinis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:14:49" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Sen. 14, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">plurium velut emeritis annorum stipendiis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:3:6:4" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 3, 6, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">rex cui (Hercules) duodecim stipendia debebat,</quote> <trans><tr>services</tr>, <tr>labors</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:2:4:18" default="NO"><author>Just.</author> 2, 4, 18</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stipes: <entryFree id="n45428" type="main" key="sti_pe^s"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stīpĕs</orth>, <itype>ĭtis</itype> (collat. form <orth extent="full" lang="la">stips</orth>, <itype>stīpis</itype>, <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 43, 5</bibl>), <gen>m.</gen> <etym>root stip-, = Gr. <foreign lang="greek">stef</foreign>-; v. stipo; Sanscr. sthapa-jami, to cause to stand, to fix, place; cf. stipula</etym>. <sense id="n45428.0" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">a log</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">post</hi>, <hi rend="ital">trunk of a tree</hi>, etc. (class.; <cit><quote lang="la">syn.: palus, sudes),</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0472,001:64:289" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cat.</author> 64, 289</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,001:7:73" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Caes.</author> B. G. 7, 73</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0448,002:1:27" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> B. C. 1, 27</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0660,001:1:1:11" default="NO"><author>Tib.</author> 1, 1, 11</bibl> (21); <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:4" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 4</bibl> (5), 2, 18; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:8:451" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 8, 451</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:2:642" default="NO"><author>id.</author> F. 2, 642</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">5, 506</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:7:524" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 7, 524</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:8:10:30" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 8, 10, 30</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:3:10" default="NO">4, 3, 10</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">deligare ad stipitem,</quote> <trans><tr>to a stake</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=nero:29" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Ner. 29</bibl></cit>.—As a term of contempt, like our <hi rend="ital">log</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stock</hi>, <hi rend="ital">post</hi>, of a stupid person: <cit><quote lang="la">in me quidvis harum rerum convenit, Quae sunt dicta in stultum, caudex, stipes, asinus, plumbeus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0134,002:5:1:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ter.</author> Heaut. 5, 1, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui, tamquam truncus atque stipes, si stetisset modo, posset sustinere tamen titulum consulatus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:9:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 9, 19</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,021:3:5" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Har. Resp. 3, 5</bibl>; id. ap. Senat. 6, 14; <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> in Eutr. 1, 126</bibl>.—</sense><sense id="n45428.1" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <usg type="style">poet.</usg> </sense><sense id="n45428.2" n="1" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:3:37" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 3, 37</bibl>; id. de Nuce, 32; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:444" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 444</bibl>; Claud. Cons. Prob. et Olybr. 179.—</sense><sense id="n45428.3" n="2" level="3"> <hi rend="ital">A branch of a tree</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0917,001:9:820" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Luc.</author> 9, 820</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1294,001:13:19:2" default="NO"><author>Mart.</author> 13, 19, 2</bibl>: candelabri, <hi rend="ital">the main stem</hi> of the candlestick, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:tlg,0527,002:37:19" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Vulg.</author> Exod. 37, 19</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stipidosus: <entryFree id="n45429" type="main" key="sti_pi^do_sus"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stīpĭdōsus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>adj.</pos> <etym>stipes</etym>, <sense id="n45429.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">woody</hi>, <hi rend="ital">ligneous</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">radix,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> Herb. 67</bibl></cit>; <bibl default="NO">74</bibl>.</sense></entryFree>
stipo: <entryFree id="n45430" type="main" key="sti_po"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stīpo</orth>, <itype>āvi, ātum, 1</itype>, <pos>v. a.</pos> <etym><foreign lang="greek">ste/fw</foreign>, to surround, crowd upon, <foreign lang="greek">ste/mma, ste/fanos</foreign>; cf.: stipator, stipulor</etym>, <sense id="n45430.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">to crowd</hi> or <hi rend="ital">press together</hi>, <hi rend="ital">to compress</hi> (class.; esp. of personal objects, and in <hi rend="ital">part. perf.;</hi> cf.: comprimo, compono). </sense><sense id="n45430.1" n="I" level="1"> <usg type="style">Lit.</usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui acceperant majorem numerum (assium), non in arcā ponebant, sed in aliquā cellā stipabant, id est componebant, quo minus loci occuparet,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=182" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 182</bibl></cit> Müll.: <cit><quote lang="la">ingens argentum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:3:465" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 3, 465</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">apes mella Stipant,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,002:4:164" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> G. 4, 164</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:1:433" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> A. 1, 433</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">materies stipata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:345" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Lucr.</author> 1, 345</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nec tamen undique corporea stipata tenentur omnia naturā,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:329" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 1, 329</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:2:294" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 2, 294</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:611" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 611</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0550,001:1:664" default="NO" valid="yes">1, 664</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">Graeci stipati, quini in lectulis, saepe plures,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,027:27:67" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Pis. 27, 67</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">velut stipata phalanx,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:33:18" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 33, 18</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">ita in arto stipatae erant naves, ut, etc.,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:26:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 26, 39</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">fratrum stipata cohors,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:10:328" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 10, 328</bibl></cit>.— <usg type="style">Poet.</usg>: stipare Platona Menandro, i. e. <hi rend="ital">to pack up together the works of Plato</hi>, <hi rend="ital">Menander</hi>, etc., <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0893,004:2:3:11" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Hor.</author> S. 2, 3, 11</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">custodum gregibus circa seu stipat euntem,</quote> <trans><tr>closely surrounds her with</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1224,001:3:8" default="NO"><author>Prop.</author> 3, 8</bibl></cit> (4, 7), 13; cf. <cit><quote lang="la">mid.: cuncta praecipiti stipantur saecula cursu,</quote> <trans><tr>throng</tr>, <tr>crowd</tr>,</trans> <bibl default="NO"><author>Claud.</author> Rapt. Pros. 2, 311</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45430.2" n="II" level="1"> <usg type="style">Transf.</usg>, <hi rend="ital">to press</hi>, <hi rend="ital">cram</hi>, <hi rend="ital">stuff</hi>, or <hi rend="ital">fill full</hi> of any thing: <cit><quote lang="la">ut pontes calonibus et impedimentis stipatos reperit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:51" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Calig. 51</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">hos (poëtas) ediscit et hos arcto stipata theatro Spectat Roma,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Hor.</author> Ep. 2, 1, 60</bibl></cit>; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">curia cum patribus fuerit stipata,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,009:3:1:143" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> P. 3, 1, 143</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">multo Patrum stipatur curia coetu,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1345,001:11:503" default="NO"><author>Sil.</author> 11, 503</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">recessus equi,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Petr.</author> 89</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tribunal,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,001:6:33:4" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> Ep. 6, 33, 4</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calathos prunis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:10:405" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 10, 405</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nucein sulfure,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1242,001:3:19" default="NO"><author>Flor.</author> 3, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">calceum,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Tert.</author> Virg. Vel. 12</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">tectum omne,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>App.</author> M. 3, p. 130, 13</bibl></cit>.—</sense><sense id="n45430.3" n="B" level="2"> With a personal object, of a dense crowd, <hi rend="ital">to surround</hi>, <hi rend="ital">encompass</hi>, <hi rend="ital">environ</hi>, <hi rend="ital">attend</hi>, <hi rend="ital">accompany</hi>,<pb n="1761" /> <cb n="STIP" />  etc. (syn.: <cit><quote lang="la">comitor, prosequor): Catilina stipatus choro juventutis, vallatus indicibus atque sicariis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,014:24:49" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Cic.</author> Mur. 24, 49</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui stipatus semper sicariis, saeptus armatis, munitus indicibus fuit,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,022:44:95" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Sest. 44, 95</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipati gregibus amicorum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,057:1:18:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Att. 1, 18, 1</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,031:1:1" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Mil. 1, 1</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">telis stipati,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,035:5:6:17" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Phil. 5, 6, 17</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">qui senatum stiparit armatis,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>id.</author> ib. 3, 12, 31</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipatus lictoribus,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,005:4:40:section=86" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> Verr. 2, 4, 40, § 86</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">senectus stipata studiis juventutis,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,051:9:28" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Sen. 9, 28</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">comitum turba est stipata suarum,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,006:3:186" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Ov.</author> M. 3, 186</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">juventus stipat ducem,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1035,001:7:557" default="NO"><author>Val. Fl.</author> 7, 557</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1318,002:23" default="NO"><author>Plin.</author> Pan. 23</bibl>; Capitol. Max. et Balb. 13.—<usg type="style"><hi rend="ital">Absol.</hi></usg>: <cit><quote lang="la">magnă stipante catervă,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0690,003:4:136" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Verg.</author> A. 4, 136</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:42:39" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 42, 39</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">huc coetus ministrūm stipantur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1020,002:3:1:87" default="NO"><author>Stat.</author> S. 3, 1, 87</bibl></cit>. —Hence, * <orth extent="full" lang="la">stīpātus</orth>, <itype>a, um</itype>, <pos>P. a.</pos>, <hi rend="ital">begirt</hi>, <hi rend="ital">surrounded</hi>: <cit><quote lang="la">ab omni ordine, sexu, aetate stipatissimus,</quote> <bibl default="NO"><author>Sid.</author> Ep. 3, 2</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>
stips: <entryFree id="n45431" type="main" key="stips1" n="1"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stips</orth>, <itype>stĭpis</itype> (<case>nom.</case> does not occur, although stips is assumed by <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=182" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 182</bibl> Müll.; <bibl default="NO"><author>Charis.</author> 85</bibl> P.; cf. Gloss. stips, <foreign lang="greek">e)/ranos</foreign>), <gen>f.</gen> <etym>kindr. with stipo, and therefore, orig., small coin in heaps; hence, in partic.</etym>, <sense id="n45431.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">a gift</hi>, <hi rend="ital">donation</hi>, <hi rend="ital">alms</hi>, <hi rend="ital">contribution</hi>, given in small coin: <cit><quote lang="la">etiam nunc dis cum thesauris asses dant, stipem dicunt,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0684,001:L. L. 5:section=182" default="NO"><author>Varr.</author> L. L. 5, § 182</bibl></cit> Müll.: stipem esse nummum signatum testimonio est, quod datur in stipendium militi et cum spondetur pecunia, quod stipulari dicitur, Fest. pp. 296 and 297 Müll.; cf.: <cit><quote lang="la">stipendium a stipe appellatum est, quod per stipes, id est modica aera colligatur,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:50:16:27" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 50, 16, 27</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">stipem Apollini conferre,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:25:12" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 25, 12</bibl></cit>; so of religious <hi rend="ital">donations</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:27:37" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>id.</author> 27, 37</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:5:25" default="NO" valid="yes">5, 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0474,044:2:9:21" default="NO"><author>Cic.</author> Leg. 2, 9, 21</bibl>; <bibl default="NO">2, 16, 40</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:57" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 57</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">quis beneficium dicat quadram panis aut stipem aeris abjecti,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Ben. 4:29:2" default="NO"><author>Sen.</author> Ben. 4, 29, 2</bibl></cit>; so of <hi rend="ital">alms</hi>, <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1014,001:Vit. Beat. 25" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Vit. Beat. 25</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,2806,001:47:22:1" default="NO"><author>Dig.</author> 47, 22, 1</bibl>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0914,001:38:45" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Liv.</author> 38, 45</bibl>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=aug.:91" default="NO"><author>Suet.</author> Aug. 91 <hi rend="ital">fin.</hi></bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">ad captandas stipes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1348,001:life=cal.:42" default="NO"><author>id.</author> Calig. 42</bibl></cit>; <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:1:189" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 1, 189</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">pastiones non minimam colono stipem conferunt,</quote> <trans><tr>bring in no small profit</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0845,001:8:1:2" default="NO"><author>Col.</author> 8, 1, 2</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">suburbanum hortum exiguā colere stipe,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0860,001:4:1:19" default="NO"><author>Curt.</author> 4, 1, 19</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">parvā cur stipe quaerat opes,</quote> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0959,007:4:350" default="NO"><author>Ov.</author> F. 4, 350</bibl></cit>; cf. <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1002,001:1:12:18" default="NO"><author>Quint.</author> 1, 12, 18</bibl>: <cit><quote lang="la">e prostitutis ancilla mercenariae stipis,</quote> <trans><tr>living by the wages of prostitution</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,0978,001:10:172" default="NO" valid="yes"><author>Plin.</author> 10, 63, 83, § 172</bibl></cit>: <cit><quote lang="la">nodosam exsolvite stipem,</quote> <trans><tr>penalty</tr>,</trans> <bibl n="Perseus:abo:phi,1038,001:2:9:1" default="NO"><author>Val. Max.</author> 2, 9, 1</bibl></cit>.</sense></entryFree>

<entryFree id="n45432" type="main" key="stips2" n="2"><orth extent="full" lang="la">stips</orth>, <itype>īpis</itype>, v. stipes <sense id="n45432.0" n="I" level="1"><hi rend="ital">init.</hi></sense></entryFree>
